VA 6.11; Κρινοτέλην Πινδάρου, θέσει δὲ Φιλοξένου IG 12(3).274 ( Anaphe), cf. 12(7).50 ( Amorgos); adoption as a citizen of a foreign state, Ἁλεξανδρεὺς θέσει, Ἁθηναῖος θ. (opp. φύσει), Suid. s.v. Ἀρίσταρχος, Ἀριστοφάνης Πόδιος.

children.label: IV
children.definition: situation, of a city, Hp. Aër. 6; πόλις αὐτάρκη θ. κειμένη Th. 1.37, cf. 5.7; ἡ θ. τῆς χώρας πρὸς τὰ πνεύματα Thphr. CP 3.23.5; τόπων θ. Plb. 1.41.7: Astron., θ. τῶν ἄστρων Herm. in Phdr. p.149A.; position, arrangement, λεγομένων καὶ γραφομένων Pl. Tht. 206a; τῶν μερῶν θέσεις Id. Lg. 668e, cf. Epicur. Ep. 1p.11U., Fr. 30 (pl.).

data.quote: ἡ θ. τῆς χώρας πρὸς τὰ πνεύματα

children.definition: local position, Arist. GC 322b33; ἔχειν θ. Id. APo. 88a34; θ. ἔχειν πρὸς ἄλληλα to have a local relation, Id. Cat. 4b21, cf. Pl. R. 586c; τῇ θ. μέσον Arist. APr. 25b36: Geom., θέσει δεδόσθαι or εἶναι, to be given in position, Archim. Sph.Cyl. 2.3, Euc. Dat. 4, Apollon.Perg. Con. 2.46, al.; παρὰ θέσει parallel to a straight line given in position, [ Euc.] Dat.Def. 15; εἰς δύο θέσεις τὰς AB, AT to meet the two straight lines AB, AT given in position, Hero Metr. 3.10; κατὰ τὴν θ. τὴν πρὸς ἡμᾶς Arist. Ph. 208b23, etc.; οὐ τῇ θ. διαφέροντα μόνον, ἀλλὰ καὶ τῇ δυνάμει ib. 22; so in Music, of notes in a scale, κατὰ θέσιν, opp. κατὰ δύναμιν, Ptol. Harm. 2.5.

data.quote: κατὰ τὴν θ. τὴν πρὸς ἡμᾶς

children.label: V
children.definition: thesis, position, assumed and requiring proof, Pl. R. 335a, Arist. Top. 104b19, APo. 72a15; θέσιν διαφυλάττειν to maintain a thesis, Id. EN 1096a2; κινεῖν to controvert it, Plu. QConv. 2.687b, cf. Alex. fort. 328a, etc.
general question, opp. ὑπόθεσις ( special case), Aphth. Prog. 13, Theon Prog. 12, cf. Cic. Top. 21.79, Quint. 3.5.5 (but θ. includes ὑπόθεσις and ὁρισμός, Phlp. in APo. 35.1; opp. ἀξίωμα, ib. 34.9).

arbitrary determination, esp. in dat. θέσει, τὰ ὀνόματα μὴ θ. γενέσθαι Epicur. Ep. 1p.27U.; opp. φύσει, Chrysipp.Stoic. 3.76, Str. 2.3.7, etc.; τὰ θ. δίκαια, νόμιμα, Ph. 1.50, 112; σημαίνειν θ. S.E. P. 2.256.

data.quote: θέσει, τὰ ὀνόματα μὴ θ. γενέσθαι

children.definition: affirmation, opp. ἄρσις, ib. 1.192, cf. 2.244, Plot. 5.5.6, etc.

children.label: VI
children.definition: a setting down, opp. ἄρσις ( lifting), πᾶσα πορεία ἐξ ἄρσεως καὶ θέσεως συντελεῖται Arist. Pr. 885b6: hence, in rhythm, downward beat, opp. the upward ( ἄρσις), Aristid.Quint. 1.13, Bacch. Harm. 98, etc.

data.quote: πᾶσα πορεία ἐξ ἄρσεως καὶ θέσεως συντελεῖται

children.label: VII
children.definition: θέσει μακρὰ συλλαβή long by position, opp. φύσει, D.T. 632.30, Heph. 1.3: orig. prob. in signf. V.3, cf. Sch.D.T. p.206H.
θέσεις, αἱ, in punctuation, stops, Donat. in Gramm.Lat. 4.372 K.

children.label: VIII
children.definition: ἡ θ. τοῦ ποδός Hippiatr. 82.

set in motion by God ( κέλλω), and so marvellous, wondrous, always of things, θ. ἔργα deeds or works of wonder, Il. 3.130, Od. 11.610; θέσκελα εἰδώς Supp. Hell. 1153: neut. Adv., ἔϊκτο δὲ θέσκελον αὐτῷ it was wondrous like him, Il. 23.107; prob. taken by later poets as, = God-inspired ( κελεύω) , θ. Ἑρμῆς Coluth. 126.

definition: θέσμιος, Dor. and Ep. τέθμιος, ον, or α, ον, ( θεσμός)

children.definition: fixed, settled, lawful, ἑορτὰ τέθμιος Pi. N. 11.27; τέθμιαι ὧραι Call. Ap. 87; θέσμια τάδε καὶ πάτρια Lex ap. Arist. Ath. 16.10; θέσμιον (sc. ἐστί) A. Ag. 1564 (lyr.); θέσμιόν ἐστι, = θέμις ἐστί, A.R. 2.12; fitting, θηρευτῆρσι σιγὴ τέθμιός ἐστι Opp. C. 1.450.

children.label: II
children.definition: θέσμιον, Dor. and Ep. τέθμιον, τό, esp. in pl., laws, customs, rites, Hdt. 1.59, A. Eu. 491 (lyr.), S. Aj. 712 (lyr.); θ. ἀναγράψαι Arist. Ath. 3.4; προγόνων παλαιὰ θ. E. Fr. 360.45, cf. Call. Dian. 174: sg. in Pi. I. 6(5).20, E. Tr. 267 (anap.):—in form θέθμιον IG 9(1).334.46 ( Locr., v B.C.).
agreement, τῶ τεθμίω ϝίστωρ ib. 7.3172.165 ( Orchom. Boeot.).

children.label: III
children.definition: Θέσμιος, title of Apollo, Paus. 5.15.7; of Demeter, Id. 8.15.4.
lawgiver, cj. for -θέτης, Longin. 9.9:—fem. θεσμο-δότειρα Orph. Εὐχή 25.
office of θεσμοθέτης at Athens, IG 2(2).1368.133.

children.label: II
children.definition: decree of fate, Plu. Fat. 2.573f.
hall in which the θεσμοθέται met, Arist. Ath. 3.5, Plu. QConv. 2.613b ( -θέτιον Suid. s.v. Πρυτανεῖον):—also θεσμοθέσιον, τό, Plu. 2.714c, Sch. Pl. Prt. 337d, Suid. s.v. ἄρχων.
to be a θεσμοθέτης, Is. 7.34, D. 59.65.
lawgiver, legislator, of Moses, Longin. 9.9.

children.label: II
children.definition: θεσμοθέται, οἱ, the six junior archons, IG 1(2).39.75, al., Ar. V. 775 (sg.), al., Antipho 6.35, Arist. Ath. 3.4, al., Aeschin. 3.38; also, title of magistrate in Amorgos, IG 12(7).57.12 (iii B.C.).

definition: θεσμοθέτις, ιδος, ἡ, = θεσμοφόρος, title of Demeter, Corn. ND 28; of Isis, Hymn.Is. 20.

children.definition: make laws, E. Ph. 1645.
AP 5.292.3 ( Paul.Sil.).

definition: θεσμός, Dor. τεθμός (v. infr.), θεθμός IG 5(2).159 ( Tegea, v B.C.), Isyll. 12, Locr. τετθμός Berl.Sitzb. 1927.8 (v B.C.): ὁ: pl. θεσμοί, poet. θεσμά S. Fr. 92: ( τίθημι):—

children.definition: that which is laid down, law, ordinance, once in Hom., λέκτροιο παλαιοῦ θεσμὸν ἵκοντο Od. 23.296; εἰρήνης θεσμοί the order of peace, h.Hom. 8.16; esp. of divine laws, θ. τὸν μοιρόκραντον ἐκ θεῶν A. Eu. 391; ἵμερος . . τῶν μεγάλων πάρεδρος θ. S. Ant. 800 (lyr.); οἱ τῶν θεῶν θ. X. Cyr. 1.6.6; θ. Ἀδραστείας, οἱ τῆς εἱμαρμένης θ., Pl. Phdr. 248c, Plu. Cons.Apoll. 2.111d; παρέβη θ. ἀρχαίους Ar. Av. 331 (lyr.).

law, οἱ πάτριοι θ. Hdt. 3.31; at Athens, esp. of the laws of Draco, IG 1(2).115.20, And. 1.81, Decr. ib. 83, Arist. Ath. 4.1, etc., cf. Ael. VH 8.10: used by Solon of his own laws, Sol. 36.16, cf. 31.2, Plu. Sol. 19; ὁ ταῦτα ἀπεργαζόμενος θ. νόμος ἂν ὀρθῶς εἴη κείμενος Pl. Ep. 355c; ὁ τοῖς ἄλλοις τιθέμενος θεσμοὺς Δημήτριος Duris 10J.; ὅδʼ ὁ τεθμὸς πὲρ τῶν ἐντοφηΐων GDI 2561 C 19 (Delph.): in later poetry, θεσμοί,= law, jurisprudence, Epigr.Gr. 434.4, al.; θεσμῶν ταμίης, πρόμαχος, IG 3.637, 638.

data.quote: ὁ ταῦτα ἀπεργαζόμενος θ. νόμος ἂν ὀρθῶς εἴη κείμενος
ὁ τοῖς ἄλλοις τιθέμενος θεσμοὺς Δημήτριος
ὅδʼ ὁ τεθμὸς πὲρ τῶν ἐντοφηΐων

children.definition: rule, precept, rite, S. Tr. 682; θ. πυρός the law of the beacon-fire, A. Ag. 304; τεθμὸς ἀέθλων Pi. O. 6.69; στεφάνων τ. the appointed crowns, ib. 13.29; θ. ὅδʼ εὔφρων the cheering strain (cf. νόμος), A. Supp. 1034 (lyr.); ὕμνου τεθμὸν Ὀλυμπιονίκαν Pi. O. 7.88; μακάρων Id. Pae. 4.47.

children.label: II
children.definition: institution, as the tribunal of the Areopagus, A. Eu. 615; τεθμὸς Ἡρακλέος, Ποτειδᾶνος τεθμοί, the Olympian, Isthmian games, Pi. N. 10.33, O. 13.40.

children.label: III
children.definition: Anacr. 58.

children.label: IV
children.definition: θεσμοί· αἱ συνθέσεις τῶν ξύλων, Hsch.
justice, AP 7.593 ( Agath.).

Thesmophoria, womenʼs festival at Athens and elsewhere, in honour of Demeter Θεσμοφόρος (q.v.), Hdt. 2.171, Ar. Av. 1519, Th. 80, 182, al.; θ. ἑστιᾶν τὰς γυναῖκας to furnish the womenʼs feast at the Th., Is. 3.80; at Ephesus, Hdt. 6.16.
keep the Thesmophoria, X. HG 5.2.29, Gloss.Oxy. 1802.35; Θεσμοφοριάζουσαι, name of a play by Aristophanes.
temple of Demeter Θεσμοφόρος, Ar. Th. 278, 880, IG 2.1059.12; at Delos, ib. 11(2).159 A 17 (iii B.C.):— also θεσμοφορεῖον Theon Prog. 5:

definition: θεσμοφόριον μέτρον, a form of dactylic metre, Mar.Vict. 6.145 K.:
θεσμοφόριος, ὁ, demoticon at Memphis, Mitteis Chr. 29.5 (ii B.C.); at Alexandria, Supp.Epigr. 2.866.

children.label: II
children.definition: μήν) name of month at Rhodes, IG 12(1).3.5; in Crete, GDI 5149.58.

definition: Θεσμοφοριών, ῶνος, ὁ, name of month at Heraclea ad Latmum, SIG 633.55 (ii B.C.); in Crete, Hemerolog.Flor.

children.definition: law-giving, epith. of Demeter, Hdt. 6.91, 134, IPE 2.13 ( Panticapaeum, iv B.C.), Call. Aet. Oxy. 2079.10 [Fr. 1.10 Pf.], D.S. 1.14, etc.; σεμνὴ Θ. AP 5.149 ( Asclep.), cf. Luc. Tim. 17; τὼ Θεσμοφόρω Demeter and Persephone, Ar. Th. 83, al.; αἱ Θεσμοφόροι App. BC 2.70, Plu. Dio 56, etc.; πότνια Θ., of Persephone, Pi. Fr. 37; also, as a title of Dionysus, Orph. H. 42.1.

guardian of the law, of Moses, Ph. 1.171:—usu. in pl. θεσμο-φύλακες, οἱ, a magistracy at Elis, Th. 5.47, cf. D.S. 5.67; at Alexandria, PHal. 1.239 (iii B.C.); in Ceos, IG 12(5).595 B 16 (iii/ii B.C.); at Ptolemais, PFay. 22.11 (i A.D.); Boeot. τεθμοφούλαξ IG 7.3172.178 (Orchom.): —hence θεσμο-φῠλάκιον [ ᾰ], τό, their office, PHal. 1.234 (iii B.C.):
νόμος Plu. Aet.Gr. 2.292d.
deliver oracular precepts: τὰ θεσμῳδούμενα oracles, Ph. 1.650.
giver of θεσμοί, Ph. ap. Eus. PE 8.7, BMus.Inscr. 4.481*.457 (pl.).

definition: θέσπαλαι αἱ Κῷαι, παρὰ Φιλητᾷ, καὶ αἱ φαρμακίδες, Hsch. (prob. Θεσσαλαί).
θεσπεσιανή, ἡ, name of an antidote, Orib. Fr. 82.
θεσπέσιος, α, ον, also ος, ον E. Andr. 296 (lyr.), Luc. Sacr. 13: (perh. for θεσ-σπέσιος, cf. θεός, ἔσπον):—prop. of the voice,

children.definition: divinely sounding, divinely sweet, ἀοιδή Il. 2.600; Σειρῆνες Od. 12.158; ἔπεα Pi. I. 4(3).39; ἀχέτας Ar. Av. 1095 (lyr.).
divinely uttered or decreed, dat. sg. fem. θεσπεσίῃ as Adv., Il. 2.367.

children.label: b
children.definition: oracular, γένος Pi. P. 12.13 (of the Graiae); δάφνα E. l.c.; θ. ὁδός the way of divination, of Cassandra, A. Ag. 1154 (lyr.); εὐχαῖς ὑπὸ θ. with prayers to the gods, Pi. I. 6(5).44.

children.label: c
children.definition: Il. 1.591; ἄντρον Od. 13.363.

children.label: II
children.definition: more than human: hence, awful, of natural phenomena, θ. νέφος Il. 15.669; ἀχλύς Od. 7.42; λαῖλαψ 9.68; marvellous, χάρις 2.12; θ. ἄωτον, χαλκός, 9.434, Il. 2.457; θ. ὀδμή a smell divinely sweet, Od. 9.211; ὀσμὴ θ. Hermipp. 82.9; of human affairs, θ. φύζα, φόβος, Il. 9.2, 17.118; πλοῦτος 2.670; ἠχή 8.159; βοή Od. 24.49; θ. ὅμιλος Theoc. 15.66: also in Prose, τέχνη θ. τις καὶ ὑψηλή Pl. Euthd. 289e; θ. βίος Id. R. 365b; θ. καὶ ἡδεῖα ἡ διαγωγή ib. 558a; σοφοὶ καὶ θ. ἄνδρες Id. Tht. 151b, cf. Philostr. Dial. 1; φύσεις Id. VS 2.9.2; θ. τὴν γνώμην Luc. Alex. 4.

children.label: III
children.definition: Adv. -ίως, θ. ἐφόβηθεν they trembled unspeakably, Il. 15.637: neut. θεσπέσιον as Adv., θ. ὑλᾶν Theoc. 25.70; also ἀπόζει θ. ὡς ἡδύ Hdt. 3.113; ὠδώδει θ. οἷον Plu. Alex. 20; θεσπεσίηθεν divinely, ἀρηρότα Emp. 96.4. —Chiefly Ep., once in Hdt., twice in Trag. (lyr.), once in Ar. (lyr.).

definition: θεσπιαοιδός, όν, ( θέσπις) poet. for θεσπιῳδός, Hsch.

children.definition: kindled by a god, θ. πῦρ portentous fire, Il. 12.177, 441, Od. 4.418, etc. ( Ep. word.)
oracular, prophetic, S. OT 463 (lyr.).

definition: θεσπίζω, fut. -ίσω, Att. -ῐῶ, Ion. inf. θεσπιέειν v.l. in Hdt. 8.135; Dor. aor. ἐθέσπιξα Theoc. 15.63: ( θέσπις):—

children.definition: prophesy, foretell, τι Hdt. 1.47, al.; τινί τι A. Ag. 1210, E. Andr. 1161:— Pass., τί δὲ τεθέσπισται; S. OC 388, cf. Parth. 35.2.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., c. acc., [ χρησμοί,] οὓς ἐθεσπίσθη Μωυσῆς Ph. 2.38.

children.label: III
children.definition: sancire, decree, Jul. Ep. 75b, Wilcken Chr. 6.8 (v A.D.), OGI 521.9 ( Abydus), Cod.Just. 1.12.3 Intr.
oracular, ἕδρα Aristonous 1.3.
Hes. Fr. 197, Orac. ap. Ar. Av. 977.

definition: θέσπις, ιος, ὁ, ἡ (acc. θέσπιδα Nonn. D. 25.452, dat. ιδι ib. 45.133): (cf. θεσπέσιος):—

children.definition: filled with the words of God, inspired, Hom. only in Od. in acc. θέσπιν; ἀοιδός 17.385; ἀοιδή 1.328, 8.498, E. Med. 425 (lyr.); also θέσπιν αὐδάν S. Ichn. 244 (lyr.).
wondrous, awful, θέσπις ἄελλα h.Ven. 208.

children.label: II
children.definition: θέσπιδες· θυσίαι, θεοσέβειαι, Hsch.
oracular utterance, Sch. Ar. Pl. 11.

definition: θέσπισμα, ατος, τό, mostly in pl.,

children.definition: oracles, oracular sayings, Hdt. 2.29, A. Fr. 86, S. OT 971: sg., E. Ion 405.
Imperial constitution, Wilcken Chr. 6.12 (pl., v A.D.), Just. Nov. 113.1.1.
prophet, Man. 6.378.
to be a θεσπιῳδός, sing in prophetic strain, A. Ag. 1161, E. Ph. 959, Ar. Pl. 9, Pl. Ax. 367d; χρησμοὶ τὸ κράτος τῆς οἰκουμένης -ῳδοῦσι Posidon. 36J.

children.label: II
children.definition: hold office of θεσπιῳδός, i.e. versifier of oracles, OGI 530.6 ( Amisus), IGRom. 4.1588 ( Claros), etc.
singing in prophetic strain, of persons, S. Fr. 456, E. Hel. 145; also ὀμφαλὸς γῆς θ. Id. Med. 668; μαντική Philostr. VS 1 Praef.: Subst. θεσπιῳδός, ἡ, = Lat. Carmenta, D.H. 1.31.

children.label: II
children.definition: θ. φόβον caused by prophecy, A. Ag. 1134 (lyr., s.v.l.).
imitate the Thessalians, Ael. VH 4.15, St.Byz. s.v. Θεσσαλία; speak like them, Parth. 24.2, D.Chr. 11.23.
serf in Thessaly, Philocr.Hist. 1.
Thessalian: Θ. ἕδος, a sort of chair or couch, Hp. Art. 7; ὄρεα Hdt. 7.128; δίφρος Eup. 58, cf. Poll. 7.112; Θ. ἔνθεσις Hermipp. 41; Θ. δεῖπνα Ar. Fr. 492, cf. Antiph. 34.3. Adv. -κῶς Crates Com. 19.
of the Thessalian dialect, ἔθος A.D. Synt. 214.6; διαίρεσις ib. 50.9. Adv. -κῶς Id. Pron. 109.1: Comp. -ώτερον Id. Synt. 159.9.

definition: Θεσσαλιῶτις, ιδος, ἡ, one of the four districts of Thessaly, Hellanic. 52J., Hdt. 1.57, Str. 9.5.3.

children.definition: Thessalian, Hdt. 5.63, etc.: prov., Θ. σόφισμα a Thessalian trick, E. Ph. 1407; Θ. νόμισμα, i.e. false money, Phot.; Thess. Πετθαλός IG 9(2).258 ( Cierium), 517.14 ( Larissa); Boeot. Φετταλός (as pr. n.) ib. 7.2430.8.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adj. Θεσσάλειος, α, ον, Gal. 15.763, al.

children.label: III
children.definition: Θεσσαλίς, ίδος, Thessalian, κυνῆ S. OC 314: as Subst. Θετταλίς, ἡ, a kind of shoe, Lysipp. 2.

pray for, c. acc. θεσσάμενος γενεήν Hes. Fr. 201; γλυκερὸν νόστον Archil. 11; παίδων γένος A.R. 1.824, cf. Euph. 136: c. inf., τάν ποτʼ εὔανδρον [εἶναι] . . θέσσαντο prayed that this land might be . . , Pi. N. 5.10 ( Hsch. also has θέσσεσθαι, θεσσόμενος, θήσω, θησόμενοι, θησάμενοι):—hence Adj. θεστός, only in compds. ἀπόθεστος, πολύθεστος (q.v.), Boeot. pr. n. Θεόφειστος, Ion. Ἐρμόθεστος. (Perh. gṷhedh-, cf. πόθος (fr. φόθος), OIr. -guidiu, Welsh gweddïo ‘pray’, Lith. gedėti ‘mournʼ; θήσω, θησόμενοι, θησάμενοι seem to be analogical formations.)
prophetic, A. Ag. 1441.
prophesy, Hsch.:—also θεσφᾰτ-όομαι, Id.

spoken by God, decreed, μόρος A. Ag. 1321; ἥκει θ. βίου τελευτή S. OC 1472: mostly in phrase θέσφατόν ἐστι, it is ordained, ὣς γὰρ θ. ἐστι Il. 8.477, cf. E. IA 1556: c. dat. pers. et inf., σοὶ δʼ οὐ θ. ἐστι . . θανέειν Od. 4.561, cf. 10.473, Pi. P. 4.71, Orac. in Ar. Pax 1073; so εἴ τι θ. πατρὶ . . ἱκνεῖθʼ, ὥστε πρὸς παίδων θανεῖν S. OC 969.

data.quote: σοὶ δʼ οὐ θ. ἐστι . . θανέειν
εἴ τι θ. πατρὶ . . ἱκνεῖθʼ, ὥστε πρὸς παίδων θανεῖν

children.definition: Subst. θέσφατα, τά, divine decrees, oracles, Od. 11.151, 297; παλαίφατα θ. 13.172, cf. Pi. I. 8(7).34: sg., E. IT 121.

children.label: II
children.definition: wonderful, mighty, ἀήρ Od. 7.143.—Cf. θεσπέσιος, θέσκελος.
to be counted as, Pl. Epin. 984a, Arist. Pol. 1277b38.

children.label: II
children.definition: θετέον, one must establish, ἆθλα Pl. Lg. 832e; one must assume, X. Mem. 4.2.15; one must reckon, count, τοὺς βαναύσους πολίτας Arist. Pol. 1277b35, cf. Satyr. Vit.Eur.Fr. 39xv6, etc.; ἐν ἁμαρτίᾳ Ph. 2.171.

definition: θετήρ, ῆρος, ὁ, EM 177.24;= τολμητής, πράκτης, Hsch.: pl., etym. of θεοί, Corn. ND 1.

children.definition: one who places, ὀνομάτων θ. name- giver, Pl. Cra. 389d.

children.label: II
children.definition: mortgagor, χωρίων Is. 10.24.

children.label: III
children.definition: adoptive father of a child, Did. ap. Harp.
temple of Thetis, E. Andr. 20, Plb. 18.20.6, Str. 9.5.6.
fit for placing, ὀνομάτων θ. prompt at giving names, D.H. Comp. 16, cf. Ph. 2.101. Adv. -κῶς appositely, D.H. Rh. 3.5.

children.label: II
children.definition: concerning adoption, νόμοι Arist. Pol. 1274b4.

children.label: III
children.definition: belonging to a θέσις, disputable, ὑπόθεσις Philostr. VS 2.6; τὰ θ. τῶν χωρίων ib. 29; so τὰ θ. alone, Phld. Rh. 1.206S.; θ. κεφάλαιον Theon Prog. 2; τὴν ζήτησιν θ. ποιεῖσθαι to make the question a matter of argument, Str. 2.3.7; Lat. genus instituendi θετικώτερον, addressed to reason rather than feeling, Cic. QF 3.3.4. Adv. Comp. -κώτερον Aps. p.333H.

children.label: IV
children.definition: positive, affirmative, opp. negative ( ἀρνητικός), Numen. ap. Eus. PE 14.8. Adv. -κῶς positively, affirmatively, D.L. 9.75; οὐ λίαν θ. not very positively, Phld. Rh. 1.371S.
positive, τὸ θετικόν the positive degree, Sch.D Il. 4.277.

children.label: b
children.definition: expressing obligation, of verbals in -τέον, D.T. 642.16; θετικῶς· τὸ ὀφειλόμενον γενέσθαι, Hsch.

children.label: V
children.definition: arbitrary, χρῆσις τῶν ὀνομάτων S.E. P. 2.256. Adv. -κῶς ib. 1.38.

definition: Θέτις, voc. Θέτῑ Il. 24.88, acc. Θέτιν, gen. ιδος 4.512, Dor. ιος Pi. I. 8(7).30, dat. Θέτῑ : ἡ :—

children.definition: Thetis, Hom., etc.
placed, set, E. IA 251 (lyr.); having position, στιγμὴ οὐσία θετός Arist. APo. 87a36.

children.label: II
children.definition: taken as oneʼs child, adopted, Pi. O. 9.62, E. Fr. 359, etc.; θετὸν παῖδα ποιεῖσθαι Hdt. 6.57, cf. Pl. Lg. 929c; θετὸς γενέσθαι τινί or ὑπό τινος, Plu. Thes. 13, App. BC 1.5; θετός, ὁ, adopted son, dub. in Is. 3.69; θετή adopted daughter, Hsch.; also θ. πατήρ adoptive father, D.S. 10.11.

definition: Θετταλός, Θετταλικός, etc., Att. for Θεσσ-.
Θετταλότμητον κρέας a lump of meat

children.definition: such as you would cut for a hungry Thessalian, Philetaer. 10.

definition: θεῦ, Dor. and Ion. for θέο, θοῦ, imper. aor. 2 Med. of τίθημι.
θευ-, Dor. and Ion. for θεο-, cf. Θεοδαίσιος, θεομορία, θεόμορος:— hence θευ-εργέσια, τά, festival of a θεὸς εὐεργέτης, Inscr.Délos 363.53 (iii B.C.).

children.definition: IG 9(1).421 ( Aetolia).
Hsch.

definition: θεύγεσθαι, Cret., = θέλγ-, Hsch. θευρός, v. θεωρός.

children.definition: running, coined as etym. of θεός, Corn. ND 1.
Hippon. 115.

definition: θέω (A), Ep. also θείω, Il. 6.507, 10.437 (in Att. the syllables εο, εου, εω are not contr.); Ep. subj. θέῃσι 22.23; 3 sg. impf. ἔθει Od. 12.407 and later, ἔθεε Il. 1.483, Hdt. 1.43 (and in later Prose, D.S. 16.94); Ep. θέε Il. 20.275, Hes. Sc. 224; Ion. impf. θέεσκον Il. 20.229: fut. θεύσομαι 23.623, Ar. Eq. 485, Av. 205, ( ὑπο-) Pi. P. 2.84, ( ἀντι-) Hdt. 5.22, ( μετα-) X. Cyn. 6.22; θεύσω Lyc. 1119: aor. 1 ἔθευσα ( δι-) Vett.Val. 345.35, part. θεύσας IGRom. 4.1740 ( Cyme):—the other tenses are supplied by τρέχω and *δρέμω : ( θεϝ-, Skt. dhávate):—

children.definition: run, ποσί, πόδεσσι, Od. 8.247, Il. 23.623; βῆ δὲ θέειν 17.698; θέῃσι τιταινόμενος πεδίοιο 22.23; ποῖ θεῖς; Ar. V. 854; θᾶττον θανάτου θεῖ [ἡ πονηρία] Pl. Ap. 39b; ὁ βραδέως θέων Id. Hp.Mi. 373d; of horses, Id. Cra. 423a; ἐν Ὀλυμπίᾳ θεόντων ἵππων Id. Lg. 822b: in part. with another Verb, ἦλθε θέων, ἦλθε θέουσα, came running, Il. 6.54, 394, etc.; ἷξε θέων, of a person on ship-board, Od. 3.288; θέων Αἴαντα κάλεσσον run and call him, Il. 12.343, etc.

περὶ τρίποδος γὰρ ἔμελλον θεύσεσθαι to run for a tripod, 11.701: metaph. (cf. τρέχω II.2), περὶ ψυχῆς θέον Ἕκτορος they were running for Hectorʼs life, 22.161; θ. περὶ ὑμέων αὐτῶν Hdt. 8.140.αʹ; θ. <τον> περὶ τοῦ παντὸς δρόμον ib. 74; περὶ γυναικῶν καὶ παίδων Paus. 6.18.3.
θ. ἐς νόσους Pl. Lg. 691c; θ. ἐγγύτατα ὀλέθρου Id. R. 417b; θεῖν παρὰ τὸν ἔσχατον κίνδυνον Plu. Fab. 26.
θεύσονται δρόμῳ Ar. Av. 205.
run; of ships, ἡ δʼ ἔθεεν κατὰ κῦμα Il. 1.483, cf. X. HG 6.2.29; of a potterʼs wheel, Il. 18.601; of a rolling stone, 13.141; of a quoit, ῥίμφα θέων ἀπὸ χειρός flying lightly . . , Od. 8.193.
δύναμις θαυμαστὴ ἐκεῖ θεῖ Plot. 2.9.8, cf. 6.5.11.

children.label: III
children.definition: φλὲψ] ἀνὰ νῶτα θέουσα διαμπερές Il. 13.547; ἄντυξ ἣ πυμάτη θέεν ἀσπίδος 6.118; ἀμφὶ δέ μιν κίβισις θέε Hes. Sc. 224; γραμμῆς περὶ [σημεῖον] θεούσης Plot. 6.5.11.

children.label: IV
children.definition: run over, τὰ ὄρη X. Cyn. 4.6, cf. 5.17; μέσσα θέων πελάγευς AP 7.273 ( Leon.), cf. 10.23 ( Autom.); πλωτῶν γένος ὑγρὰ θεόντων Opp. H. 3.183.—The simple Verb is used in Trag. only by E. Ion 1217.
shine, gleam, ὀδόντων λευκὰ θεόντων Hes. Sc. 146 ( λευκαθεόντων cj. Wackernagel); ὕλῃ χλωρὰ θεούσῃ cj. in Theoc. 25.158; ποίην . . χλωρὰ θέουσαν IG 14.1389ii 24; cf. θοός (B), Λευκαθέα, λευκαθίζω.

definition: θεῶ, for θεάου, imper. of θεάομαι,

children.definition: behold!
place for seeing, Hsch. s.v. θαυσήκρι.

definition: θεωρέω:— Pass., fut. -ηθήσομαι S.E. M. 8.280: fut. Med. in pass.sense, ib. 1.70, Ael. VH 7.10: ( θεωρός):—

children.definition: to be a θεωρός I (q.v.), μαντεύεσθαι καὶ θ. Th. 5.18; ἐγὼ δὲ τεθεώρηκα πώποτʼ οὐδαμοῖ πλὴν ἐς Πάρον Ar. V. 1188; of the states which sent θεωροί, οἱ Ἀθηναῖοι ἐθεώρουν ἐς τὰ Ἴσθμια Th. 8.10.

data.quote: ἐγὼ δὲ τεθεώρηκα πώποτʼ οὐδαμοῖ πλὴν ἐς Πάρον
θεωροί, οἱ Ἀθηναῖοι ἐθεώρουν ἐς τὰ Ἴσθμια

children.definition: to be sent to consult an oracle, Pl. Ep. 315b.

children.label: II
children.definition: τὰ Ὀλύμπια Hdt. 1.59; ἀγῶνα Id. 8.26, X. An. 1.2.10; θ. τινά to see him act, Thphr. Char. 11.3: abs., And. 4.20, D. 18.265; to go as a spectator, ἐς τὰ Ἐφέσια Th. 3.104; ἐς Ὀλυμπίαν Luc. Tim. 50; v. sub ὀβολός I.

children.label: III
children.definition: look at, behold, γῆν πολλήν Hdt. 4.76; τύχας τινός A. Pr. 304; τὰ περὶ τὸν πόλεμον Pl. R. 467c; inspect, review soldiers, X. An. 1.2.16, HG 4.5.6: abs., gaze, gape, ἑστηκὼς θ. Thphr. Char. 4.5: Astrol., = ἐπιθεωρέω 5, τὴν σελήνην Gal. 19.542.

contemplate, consider, αὐτῇ τῇ ψυχῇ αὐτὴν τὴν ψυχὴν θ. Pl. Grg. 523e; τὰ ὄντα ᾗ ὄντα Arist. Metaph. 1003b15, cf. D. 1.12, Epicur. Nat. 2.6, etc.: folld. by an interrog., τοῦτο θ., εἰ τἀληθῆ λέγω D. 3.3; θ. τινά, ὁποτέρου τοῦ βίου ἐστίν Aeschin. 3.168; πόσας ἔχουσι διαφοράς Arist. GA 761a11; θ. τίνας λέγομεν τοὺς φρονίμους Id. EN 1140a24; θ. τι ἔκ τινος to judge of one thing by another, τὴν ἔννοιαν ἐκ τῶν ἔργων Is. 1.13, cf. Aeschin. 3.160; θ. τι πρός τι compare one thing with another, D. 18.17; πρὸς τοὺς πρὸ ἐμαυτοῦ . . κρίνωμαι καὶ θεωρῶμαι; ib. 315; τοὺς πρέσβεις θ. πρὸς τὸν καιρὸν καθʼ ὃν ἐπρές βευον Aeschin. 2.80; θ. [τι τεκμηρίοις] D. 21.199.

data.quote: θ. τινά, ὁποτέρου τοῦ βίου ἐστίν
τοὺς πρέσβεις θ. πρὸς τὸν καιρὸν καθʼ ὃν ἐπρές βευον

children.label: b
children.definition: observe, θ. μᾶλλον τοὺς πέλας δυνάμεθα ἢ ἑαυτούς Arist. EN 1169b33, cf. Pol. 1263b25, al.; ταῦτα ἐμοῦ ἐθεωρήσατε, ὡς . . ποιουμένου Lycurg. 28:— Pass., τεθεώρηται τοῦτο μάλιστα ἐπὶ τῶν περιστερῶν Arist. HA 562a23, cf. 540b19, al.; λόγῳ θεωρεῖσθαι, of objects not accessible to sense, Phld. D. 3.10: abs., ὡς καὶ ἐπʼ ἄλλων θεωρεῖται ib. 1.13.

data.quote: θ. μᾶλλον τοὺς πέλας δυνάμεθα ἢ ἑαυτούς
τεθεώρηται τοῦτο μάλιστα ἐπὶ τῶν περιστερῶν

children.label: c
children.definition: perceive, c. inf., ἀναγκαῖον ὑπάρχειν D.S. 13.88.

children.label: d
children.definition: speculate, theorize, ἀκριβῶς, φορτικῶς, Arist. Pol. 1280b28, Metaph. 1001b14; λογικῶς, φυσικῶς, Id. APo. 88a19, Cael. 304a25; περί τινος Id. Metaph. 1004b1, 983a33 ( Pass.); θ. ἔκ τινος to conclude by observation from . . , ib. 1029a26; διά τινος Id. Mete. 353b18:— Pass., ἡ παρὰ τοῖς Ἕλλησι τεθεωρημένη μάθησις Ael. Tact. Prooem. ( θεωρήσασα is prob. corrupt for ἐωρ- in S. OC 1084 (lyr.).)
sight, spectacle, λόγοι καὶ θεωρήματα D. 18.68; θ. καὶ ἀκροάματα Aristox. Fr. Hist. 15; θ. καὶ ἀκούσματα D.C. 52.30: generally, festival, ὅσα Μουσῶν ὠσὶν ἔχεται θεωρήματα Pl. Lg. 953a.
object of contemplation, τὸ ἐν ἡμῖν φάντασμα δεῖ ὑπολαβεῖν . . εἶναι θ. Arist. Mem. 450b25; vision, Id. Div.Somn. 463b19; intuition, θ. κοινά Chrysipp.Stoic. 3.72, al., cf. Phld. Po. 5.25 (pl.).

children.label: II
children.definition: speculation, theory, Arist. Metaph. 1083b18, Top. 104b1; τὰ κατὰ φυσιολογίαν θ. Metrod. Herc. 831.8; speculative proposition, M.Ant. 1.8.

children.label: b
children.definition: datum or rule of art, Cic. Fam. 6.11 (pl.); τέχνης θ. Phld. Rh. 2.94S., al.(pl.), cf. Stoic. 3.51; ἰατρικῆς θ. Corn. ND 33 (pl.); scheme, plan, Plb. 6.26.10: pl., θεωρήματα, τά, arts and sciences, Id. 10.47.12; αἱ τέχναι ἐκ -ημάτων εἰσίν Gal. 1.106.

children.label: c
children.definition: theorem, Archim. Sph.Cyl. 1 Prooem., al., Papp. 30.6, al., Procl. in Euc. p.201 F.; also ἀστρονομικὰ θ. Phlp. in Mete. 104.19.
subject of investigation, Plb. 1.2.1, D.H. Comp. 2.

children.label: b
children.definition: investigation, Plu. Mus. 2.1131c.
to be interpreted as seen, ὄνειροι, opp. ἀλληγορικοί, Artem. 4.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: theoretic, ἀρετή Stoic. 3.48, cf. Iamb. Protr. 21.λβ, D.L. 3.49; dogmatic, epith. of Metrodorus, Id. 2.113; contemplative, βίος Jul. ad Them. 265b (11); opp. πρακτικός, Id. Or. 6.190a.

definition: θεωρημάτιον, τό, Dim. of θεώρημα, Arr. Epict. 2.21.17, 3.5.15.

children.definition: contemplative, Choerob. in An.Ox. 2.220.
viewing, τραγικαὶ θ. Pl. Phlb. 48a.
one must consider, investigate, εἴτε . . εἴτε . . Pl. Lg. 815b; τίνι διαφέρει . . Arist. Ph. 193b23, etc.
seat in a theatre, Plu. CG 12 (pl.), CIG 2782.20 ( Aphrodisias).
spectator, ἐργάται τῶν καλῶν καὶ θ. Phld. Oec. p.63J., cf. Hsch. s.v. θεωρούς.

children.label: II
children.definition: overseer, director, Sch. Opp. H. 3.257.
able to perceive, τοῦ περὶ τὰ σώματα κάλλους Arist. Pol. 1338b1; μὴ πάντων θ. ἀλλὰ ἐνίων Phld. Rh. 2.108S.; τῆς ἀφροσύνης S.E. M. 11.256.

contemplative, speculative, ὁ περὶ τὴν . . οὐσίαν θ. Arist. Metaph. 1005a35; ὁ περὶ φύσεως θ. Id. PA 641a29: c. gen., μαντικὴ ἐπιστήμη θ. τοῦ . . μέλλοντος Pl. Def. 414b; ἐπιστήμη θ., διάνοια, opp. πρακτική, ποιητική, Arist. Metaph. 1064a17, 1025b25; νοῦς Id. de An. 415a11; θ. βίος a contemplative or speculative life (opp. ἀπολαυστικός, πολιτικός), Id. EN 1095b19, cf. Plu. Cic. 3; θ. φιλόσοφος Id. Per. 16: Comp. -ώτερος Herm. in Phdr. p.59A. Adv. -κῶς Epicur. Nat. 28.7, Poll. 4.8, Iamb. Comm.Math. 20.
that may be seen, D.S. 14.60; ὄψει θ. Ael. NA 9.4; θ. κατασκεύασμα Secund. Sent. 1; of certain days in disease, to be watched (cf. ἐπίδηλος II.1), Hp. Aph. 2.24.

to be reached by contemplation, τοὺς διὰ λόγου θ. χρόνους Epicur. Ep. 1p.10U.; θεοὺς λόγῳ θ. Id. Fr. 355, cf. Phld. Sign. 37; opp. ἐμφανής, Plu. QConv. 2.722d; λόγῳ ib. 876c. Adv. -τῶς Gal. 18(1).363.
presents made by the bridegroom to the bride, when she first unveiled herself, Eust. 881.31, Harp.

definition: θεωρία, Ion. θεωρίη, Dor. θεᾱρία (v. infr.), Boeot. θιαωρία Ἐφ.Ἀρχ. 1892.34: ἡ:—

children.definition: sending of θεωροί or state-ambassadors to the oracles or games, or, collectively, the θεωροί themselves, embassy, mission, θεωρίαν ἀπάγειν εἰς Δῆλον Pl. Phd. 58b: pl., opp. στρατεῖαι, Id. R. 556c; ἄγειν τῷ Διὶ τῷ Νεμείῳ τὴν κοινὴν ὑπὲρ τῆς πόλεως θ. D. 21.115, cf. X. Mem. 4.8.2, Decr.Byz. ap. D. 18.91 ( θεᾱρία), Plb. 28.19.4.
office of θεωρός, discharge of that office, τῆς Ὀλυμπίαζε θ. Th. 6.16, cf. Isoc. 19.10, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: being a spectator at the theatre or games, S. OT 1491; οὔτʼ ἐπὶ θεωρίαν πώποτε ἐκ τῆς πόλεως ἐξῆλθες Pl. Cri. 52b; personified in Ar. Pax 523, al.

data.quote: οὔτʼ ἐπὶ θεωρίαν πώποτε ἐκ τῆς πόλεως ἐξῆλθες

children.label: III
children.definition: viewing, beholding, θεωρίης εἵνεκεν ἐκδημεῖν to go abroad to see the world, Hdt. 1.30; κατὰ θεωρίης πρόφασιν ib. 29; ἐκπέμπειν τινὰ κατʼ ἐμπορίαν καὶ κατὰ θεωρίαν Isoc. 17.4, cf. Arist. Ath. 11.1, Th. 6.24; pilgrimage, E. Ba. 1047.

data.quote: ἐκπέμπειν τινὰ κατʼ ἐμπορίαν καὶ κατὰ θεωρίαν

children.definition: contemplation, consideration, Pl. Phlb. 38b: pl., θεῖαι θ. Id. R. 517d: c. gen., παντὸς μὲν χρόνου πάσης δὲ οὐσίας ib. 486a; ἡ τῶν ἀρχῶν, ἡ τῶν ὅλων θ., Epicur. Ep. 2p.55U., Phld. Rh. 1.288S.; θ. ποιεῖσθαι περί τινος Arist. Metaph. 989b25; ἡ περὶ φύσεως θ. Epicur. Ep. 1p.3U., etc.: pl., τὰς σαθρὰς αὐτοῦ θ. Demetr.Lac. Herc. 124.12.

children.label: b
children.definition: theory, speculation, opp. practice, Plb. 1.5.3; ἡ περὶ τὰ στρατόπεδα θ. Id. 6.42.6; αἱ νυκτεριναὶ καὶ ἡμεριναὶ θ. theoretic reckoning of night and day, Id. 9.14.6; ἡ μαθηματικὴ θ. Plu. Rom. 12.
Pass., sight, spectacle, A. Pr. 802, etc.; esp. public spectacle at the theatre or games, Ar. V. 1005, X. Hier. 1.12; ἡ τοῦ Διονύσου θ. the Dionysia, Pl. Lg. 650a.
explanatory preface to a μελέτη, Chor. in Hermes 17.208, etc.: so in Philos., continuous exposition, Olymp. in Mete. 18.30, al.
of or for θεωρία (signfs. I and II), πεπλώματʼ οὐ θεωρικά no festal robes, E. Supp. 97; θ. σκηνή the tent used by the θεωροί, Henioch. 5.8; θ. ὁδός,= θεωρίς I.2, Poll. 2.55. Adv. -κῶς Hsch.

children.label: II
children.definition: θεωρικόν, τό ( θεωρικός, ὁ, seems to be an error in Phld. Rh. 2.208 S.), at Athens, fund for providing free seats at public spectacles, οἱ ἐπὶ τὸ θ. Arist. Ath. 43.1, cf. 47.2, D. 18.113, IG 2(2).223 C5; ἡ ἀρχὴ ἡ ἐπὶ τῷ θ. Aeschin. 3.24: pl. (sc. χρήματα), D. 3.11, Harp., etc., cf. Plu. Per. 9: so elsewh. θεωρικά, with or without χρήματα, fund for festivals, POxy. 1333 (ii/iii A.D.), 473.4 (ii A.D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: θεώριον, τό, box at the amphitheatre, PSI 8.953.62 (vi A.D.).
ναῦς) sacred ship, which carried the θεωροί to their destination, Hdt. 6.87, cf. Call. Del. 314: metaph., ἄστολος θ., of Charonʼs bark, A. Th. 858 (lyr.).
ὁδός) road by which the θεωροί went, Hsch.

children.label: II
children.definition: Βάκχαι, Id., cf. Plb. 30.25.12; of attendants of Apollo, Nonn. D. 9.261.
act as θεωροδόκος, SIG 562.50 (Paros, from Magn. Mae.).
office of θεωροδόκος, BCH 49.91 ( Delph., iii B.C.), SIG 608.5,10 (ib., ii B.C.): Dor. θεᾱροδοκία, τῶν Δηλίων CIG 2329 ( Delos).

definition: θεωροδόκος, Dor. and Arc. θεᾱροδόκος, Thess. θεουρο- Inscr.Magn. 26, Corc. θιᾱρο- ib. 44: ὁ:—

children.definition: one who receives the θεωροί, IG 4.727 ( Hermione, iv B.C.), 5(2).389 ( Lusi), SIG 608.7 ( Delph., ii B.C.), etc.
envoy sent to consult an oracle, S. OT 114, OC 413; to present an offering, Orac. ap. D. 21.53; to be present at festivals, θεωροὺς εἰς τὰ Πύθια πέμψαι D. 19.128, cf. D.H. Lys. 29, etc.
envoy, sent to kings regarded as divine, Plu. Demetr. 11, Ath. 13.607c.

children.label: II
children.definition: magistrate at Mantinea, Th. 5.47; at Naupactus, IG 9(1).360 (pl.), cf. ib. 12(5).527 (found in Ceos); at Thasos, ib. 12(8).267, etc.

children.label: III
children.definition: spectator, Thgn. 805, A. Pr. 118, Ch. 246, Fr. 289; πολέμου Pl. R. 467c, etc.; opp. ἀγωνιστής, Achae. 3; one who travels to see men and things, Pl. Lg. 951a, 953c; also λαμπάδα θ. εἰκάδων E. Ion 1076 (lyr., s.v.l.). ( Uncontr. θεαορός Schwyzer 664.30 (Orchom. Arc., iv B.C.): contr. θεᾱρός in Dor. ( SIG 558.24, etc.), Arc. ( IG 5(2).4 ( Tegea), etc.): θεουρός Thess. ( Inscr.Magn. 26): θευρός Thas. ( IG 12(8). l.c.); θιᾱρός Corc. ( Inscr.Magn. 44).) (Perh. fr. θεᾱ-hορϝος, cf. θεη-κόλος and θυρωρός ( θυρουρός) fr. θυρᾰ-hορϝος.)
making divine, Dam. Pr. 100 (pl.).
sprung from Thebes, Theban, Hes. Th. 530: distd. fr. Θηβαῖος, Ephor. 21 J.:—also Θηβαιγενής, E. Supp. 136, D.P. 623.

Thebes, Θ. Αἰγύπτιαι . . αἳ ἑκατόμπυλοί εἰσι Il. 9.381: also sg., Θήβης ἑπταπύλοιο ( Boeotia) 4.406:—hence Θήβασδε to Thebes, 23.679; Att. Θήβαζε Sch. Il. 3.29, al.; Θήβησιν at Thebes, Il. 22.479, Arist. Rh. 1398b2, Θήβησι Il. 14.114: from the sg., Θήβηθεν from Thebes, Ephipp. 15.7; poet. Θήβηθε APl. 16.185; Boeot. Θείβᾱθεν from Thebes, Ar. Ach. 862, also Θείβᾱθε ( Θείβ-αθι codd.) ib. 868:— Adj. Θηβαιεύς, έως, Ion. έος, ὁ, epith. of Zeus, Theban, Hdt. 1.182, etc.: Θηβαῖος, α, ον, Theban, Od. 10.492, etc.; Θηβαΐας (metri gr.) S. Ant. 1135 (lyr.): Θηβαϊκός, ή, όν, Hdt. 2.4, etc.

definition: Θηβαΐς, ΐδος, ἡ, Thebais, i.e. territory of Thebes (in Egypt), Hdt. 2.28; (in Boeotia), Id. 9.65, Th. 3.58:—hence Θηβαΐτης [ ῑ], ου, ὁ,

children.definition: dweller in the Egyptian Thebais, Str. 17.1.40.

children.label: II
children.definition: Thebaid, a poem on the siege of Thebes, which formed a portion of the Epic cycle, Paus. 8.25.8.
the north-east wind ( καικίας) in Lesbos, Arist. Vent. 973a9:—also Θήβανις, ὁ, St.Byz. s.v. Ἄδανα (because it blew from Hypoplacian Thebes), Hdn.Gr. 1.95.
governor of the Thebaid, OGI 139.6 (pl., Philae, ii B.C.), 190.7 (ibid., i B.C.).

definition: θῆβος (i.e. θῆϝος) · θαῦμα, and θήγεια (i.e. θήϝεια) · θαυμαστά, ψευδῆ, Hsch.

children.definition: pointed, sharp, στάλικες AP 6.109 (Antip.); τρύφος ib. 7.542 (Flacc.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., sharpening, c. gen. rei, ib. 6.68 ( Jul.Aegypt.):—also θηγάνεος, Hsch.
whetstone, A. Ag. 1536 (lyr.), S. Aj. 820: metaph., αἱματηρὰς θηγάνας incentives to bloodshed, A. Eu. 859; θ. λάλης Luc. Lex. 14:—also θήγανον, τό, Hsch.

definition: θηγανίτης [ ῑ] λίθος, ὁ, a hard stone, used for

children.definition: whetstones, gen. θηγανείτα, IG 14.317 (Therm. Himer.).
Herm. in A. Ag. 1535 from Hsch., cf. EM 450.13.

definition: θήγη, ἡ, softer form of θήκη, Hsch. (v. διαθιγή).

children.definition: sharp, Hsch.

definition: θήγω, Dor. θάγω [ᾱ] Ar. Lys. 1256: fut. θήξω E. Cyc. 242: aor. ἔθηξα Pi. O. 10(11).20, E. Or. [51]:— Med., aor. ἐθηξάμην (v. infr.):— Pass., pf. τέθηγμαι (v. infr.):—

children.definition: X. and later, v. infr.), sharpen, whet, Hom. (only in Il.), θήγων λευκὸν ὀδόντα 11.416, cf. 13.475, Hes. Sc. 388; ὀδόντα Ar. Ra. 815 (hex.); γένυν E. Ph. 1380; θ. φάσγανον, ξίφος, μαχαίρας, A. Ag. 1262, E. Or. 1036, Cyc. 242; ξίφη Onos. 28; ὀϊστούς Jul. Or. 7.229a:— Med., δόρυ θηξάσθω let him whet his spear, Il. 2.382, cf. Phanocl. 1.8.

sharpen, excite, Pi. O. 10(11).20; ἰάμβων τοὺς ὀδόντας Babr. Prooem. 2.14; provoke, τὰς ψυχὰς εἰς τὰ πολεμικά X. Cyr. 2.1.20, cf. 1.2.10 ( Pass.), Mem. 3.3.7; τεθηγμένον τοί μʼ οὐκ ἀπαμβλυνεῖς λόγῳ A. Th. 715; λόγοι τεθηγμένοι sharp, biting words. Id. Pr. 313; οὐ γάρ μʼ ἀρέσκει γλῶσσά σου τεθηγμένη S. Aj. 584; λῆμα τεθ. E. Or. 1625; τῆς διανοίας ὀργῇ τεθ. Alcid. ap. Arist. Rh. 1406a10.

data.quote: τεθηγμένον τοί μʼ οὐκ ἀπαμβλυνεῖς λόγῳ
οὐ γάρ μʼ ἀρέσκει γλῶσσά σου τεθηγμένη

children.label: II
children.definition: ὀργὴ γέροντος . . ἐν χειρὶ θήγει σὺν τάχει δʼ ἀμβλύνεται dub. in S. Fr. 894.

definition: θηέομαι, Ion. form of θεάομαι. θήῃς, v. τίθημι.
θηητήρ, ῆρος, ὁ, Ion. for θεατής,

children.definition: one who gazes at, an admirer, θ. τόξων Od. 21.397; ἀκρασίης Perict. ap. Stob. 4.28.19.

definition: θηητός, ή, όν, Ion. for θεατός, Dor. θᾱητός,

children.definition: gazed at, wondrous, admirable, Hes. Th. 31, Tyrt. 10.29, Call. Dian. 141; θ. ἀγών, γυῖα, Pi. O. 3.36, P. 4.80: in later Ion. Prose θεητός Aret. CD 1.4.
brimstone, Od. 22.493. θήϊος, Ep. for θεῖος (A); cf. θῇος.
like a chest or coffin, οἴκημα θ. burial vault, Hdt. 2.86; perh. to be read in Plu. Isid. 2.359a.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst. θηκαῖον, τό, = θήκη, SIG 1120 (pl., Cos).

definition: θηκάριον, τό, Dim. of θήκη, Sch. Opp. H. 2.356.

children.definition: case, chest, χρυσοῦ θ. a money- chest, Hdt. 3.130, 9.83, E. Hec. 1147, cf. X. Oec. 8.17, etc.

grave, tomb, A. Pers. 405, S. OC 1763 (anap.); νεκρῶν θήκας ἀνοίγειν Hdt. 1.187, cf. 67, al.; αἱ θ. τῶν τεθνεώτων Th. 1.8, 3.104; εἰς ἀναισχύντους θ. ἐτράποντο modes of burial, Id. 2.52, cf. Pl. R. 427b; θήκην ὀρύττειν X. Cyr. 7.3.5.
ξίφους θ. sword- sheath, Poll. 10.144; τόξου bow- case, EM 333.41.

definition: θηκίον, τό, Dim. of θήκη, PFay. 104.5 (iii A.D.), IG 12(3).1238 ( Melos, iii/iv A.D.), Hsch.

children.definition: store up, BGU 757.15 (i A.D.):— Pass., χόρτος τεθηκοποιημένος PRyl. 142.16 (i A.D.).
scabbard-maker, Lyd. Mag. 1.46.
cistophorus, Lyd. Mag. 3.8.
sharpened, whetted, A. Th. 942 (lyr.), E. Med. 40, AP 6.110 ( Leon. or Mnasalc.), Pancrat. Oxy. 1085.23.

definition: θηλάζω, Dor. aor. 1 ἐθήλαξα Theoc. 3.16 (v.l. -αζε): ( θηλή):

children.label: I
children.definition: suckle, Phryn.Com. 29, Lys. 1.9, Arist. HA 576b10: abs., give suck, οἱ μαστοί, οἳ οὐκ ἐθήλασαν Ev.Luc. 23.29:—also in Med., ἐπιμελεῖσθαι, ὅπως μέτριον χρόνον θηλάσονται Pl. R. 460d, cf. Arist. HA 566b17; οὐ συλλαμβάνουσι θηλαζόμεναι Id. GA 777a13, cf. IG 5(2).514.12 ( Lycosura):— Pass., to be sucked, ὁ δελφὶς . . θηλάζεται ὑπὸ τῶν τέκνων Arist. HA 504b25.

data.quote: ὁ δελφὶς . . θηλάζεται ὑπὸ τῶν τέκνων

children.label: II
children.definition: suck, Id. GA 733b29, etc.; ἐλέφαντος ὁ σκύμνος θ. τῷ στόματι Id. HA 578a22; θηλάζων χοῖρος a sucking pig, Theoc. 14.15; seldom of an infant, Orph. Fr. 49.87.

data.quote: ἐλέφαντος ὁ σκύμνος θ. τῷ στόματι

children.definition: λεαίνας μασδὸν ἐθήλαξεν Theoc. 3.16; ἐὰν μὴ τύχῃ τεθηλακὼς ὁ ὄνος ἵππον Arist. HA 577b16. (Written θελάσζ- PSI 4.368.19 (iii B.C.).)

data.quote: ἐὰν μὴ τύχῃ τεθηλακὼς ὁ ὄνος ἵππον

children.definition: a suckling, Hsch. (nisi leg. θηλαμόνος).

definition: θηλαμών, όνος, ἡ, = θηλάστρια, Sophr. 43, Thespis 4.2, Lyc. 31; prob. for θηλονάς, Plu. Aet.Gr. 2.278d.

children.definition: motherʼs nursing, suckling, PMasp. 5.24 (vi A.D.), PLond. 5.1708.82 (vi A.D.).
giving suck, suckling, Plu. Rom. 4, Aem. 14.
one who suckles, wet-nurse, S. Fr. 98, Cratin. 418, Eup. 417.
θηλεογονία, = θηλυγονία II, Gloss.

definition: θηλέω, Dor. θᾱλέω, Ep. impf. θήλεον Od. 5.73: fut. θηλήσω ( ἀνα-) Il. 1.236: Dor. poet. aor. θάλησα Pi. N. 4.88; part. θηλήσας AP 9.363 ( Mel.): ( τεθηλημένα is f.l. in Hp. Insomn. 90):—

children.definition: θάλλω, to be full of, abound in, c. gen., λειμῶνες μαλακοὶ ἴου ἠδὲ σελίνου θήλεον Od. l.c.: c. dat., θάλησε σελίνοις Pi. l.c.; νικοφορίαις ἄστυ θάλησε ib. 10.42.
grow luxuriantly, flourish, A.R. 3.221, AP l.c.; of a child, IG 14.1971; prob. for ἐθάλλεον, Epigr. ap. Plu. Cons.Apoll. 2.110b.

children.label: II
children.definition: make to bloom, Alex.Aet. 3.9.
teat, nipple, E. Cyc. 56 (lyr.), Hp. Epid. 5.101, Pl. Cra. 414a; τῶν μαστῶν ἡ θ., διʼ ἧς . . τὸ γάλα διηθεῖται Arist. HA 493a13; of animals, ib. 500a24; θ. πεφιλοτεχνημέναι dumb teats, Sor. 1.115.

data.quote: τῶν μαστῶν ἡ θ., διʼ ἧς . . τὸ γάλα διηθεῖται

children.label: II
children.definition: head of a pole, κοντοὶ σὺν θηλαῖς σιδηραῖς PLond. 3.1164h9 (iii A.D.).
quiet, Cyr. θηλητήρ· κυνηγός, Hsch.
nipple-shaped, Gloss.
of female sex, womanish, στόλος A. Supp. 28, cf. E. Ba. 1156; ὄχλος ib. 117: Comp., Pl. Lg. 802e. Adv. -νῶς Eust. 10.27.
with womanʼs tongue, Νοσσίς AP 9.26.7 (Antip. Thess.).
generate or promote the generation of females, Thphr. HP 9.18.5, Ph. 1.262, Dsc. 3.126.
generation of females, opp. κουρογονίη, Hp. Genit. 8; opp. ἀρρενογονία, Arist. HA 585b11, GA 765a30, S.E. M. 5.7.

children.label: II
children.definition: kin by the motherʼs side, Hdn. 1.7.4;= Lat. cognatio, Just. Nov. 115.3.14.
generating females, Hp. Steril. 230; καὶ γυναῖκες καὶ ἄνδρες . . θ. εἰσίν Arist. HA 585b13; of animals, ib. 573b32, GA 766b32.

data.quote: καὶ γυναῖκες καὶ ἄνδρες . . θ. εἰσίν

children.label: II
children.definition: θηλυγόνον, τό, a plant supposed to promote the generation of females, dog-mercury, Mercurialis perennis, Thphr. HP 9.18.5; a variety of φύλλον, Dsc. 3.125;= λινόζωστις θήλεια, Ps.- Dsc. 4.189.

definition: θηλυδρίας, ου, Ion. θηλυδρ-ίης, εω, ὁ,

children.definition: effeminate person, Hdt. 7.153, Ph. 1.262, Luc. DDeor. 8[5].3, S.E. P. 3.217 (pl.), Lib. Or. 64.83 (pl.); of animals, Arist. HA 631b17:—hence θηλυδριάω, Gloss.
effeminate, μέλος Ar. Th. 131; λόγοι Sch. E. Andr. 757. Adv. -δῶς Sch.D.T. p.247 H.
ῥᾳστώνη Prisc. p.332 D.
woman-like, ἄνδρες Arist. GA 747a1; like the female, of male animals, Id. HA 589b30: Comp., Id. Pr. 961a6.

children.label: b
children.definition: womanish, ultra-feminine, opp. ἀρρενωπός, Id. GA 728a3.
feminine, γένος D.T. 634.17, D.H. Amm. 2.11; μόριον ibid.; ὄνομα Ph. 1.294. Adv. -κῶς Arist. Fr. 499, Phld. Piet. 12, Str. 6.1.10, A.D. Synt. 222.6, Alex.Aphr. in Sens. 151.1.
female, PCair.Zen. 166.2 (iii B.C.), LXX Nu. 5.3, IG 14.872 ( Cumae), Sor. 1.32.

children.label: b
children.definition: θ. κεντήματα bites of female vipers, Philum. Ven. 16.3.

children.label: c
children.definition: Ptol. Tetr. 20, 33.
the female κράνεια, dogwood, Cornus sanguinea, Thphr. HP 1.8.2, 3.3.1.
swaying women, ἔρως A. Ch. 599 (lyr.).
slaying by womanʼs hand, Ἄρης θ. A. Pr. 860.
of effeminate nature, Procl. Par.Ptol. 265.
to be mad after women, Ph. 2.20, Man. 4.164.
mad after women, AP 5.18 ( Rufin.); Πόθοι Id. 9.16 ( Mel.); of animals, ἵπποι θ. LXX Je. 5.8.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., maddening women, κροτάλων θ. ὄτοβοι Antim. Eleg. 17:—hence θηλυ-μᾰνία, ἡ, Sch. Opp. H. 1.536, Cat.Cod.Astr. 2.177.
singing in soft strain, Ἀλκμᾶνος ἀηδόνες AP 9.184.
with a womanʼs μίτρα, in womanʼs clothes, Luc. DDeor. 22[18].1: acc. -μίτρην prob. cj. for -μητριν, -μιτριν, Id. Bacch. 3.
woman-shaped, E. Ba. 353; female in type, Arist. Phgn. 809b37 ( Comp.); ἰδέα Ph. 2.261; θεότης Dam. Pr. 204; of the number 4, Nicom. ap. Phot. Bibl. p.144B.
of womanish mind, A. Pr. 1003.

definition: θηλύνω, Plu. Es. carn. 2 2.999a: aor. ἐθήλῡνα E. Fr. 360.29, Babr. Prooem. 1.19, ( ἐξ-) Str. 5.4.13: pf. τεθήλῠκα Arist. ap. Stob. 4.279M.:— Pass., aor. ἐθηλύνθην (v. infr.), ( ἐξ-) D.H. 14.8: pf. τεθήλυσμαι Hp. Aër. 15, J. AJ 4.8.40, ( ἐκ-) Gal. 10.354; but -υμμαι ( ἐκ-) Plb. 36.15.2, Luc. DDeor. 8[5].3; 3 sg. -υνται D.C. 50.27; inf. -ύνθαι ( ἐκ-) Plb. 31.21.3: ( θῆλυς):—

children.definition: make womanish, enervate, E. l.c.; τὴν ἡδονήν Plu. l.c.; τοὺς ἄνδρας Vett.Val. 76.6; soften, Ζέφυρος κῦμα θηλύνει AP 10.4 ( Marc.Arg.):— Pass., τῶν σωμάτων -ομένων X. Oec. 4.2, cf. Porph. Abst. 1.34; become soft, αἱ σάρκες -ονται Hp. Art. 52; βαφῇ σίδηρος ὥς, ἐθηλύνθην στόμα S. Aj. 651; οὔπω ἐθηλύνθης gavʼst not yet a sign of yielding, AP 5.250 ( Iren.); θ. οἴκτοις ib. 299 ( Paul.Sil.); play the coquette, Bion 2.18; τᾷ μορφᾷ θηλύνετο Theoc. 20.14; muliebria pati, Vett.Val. 7.26, al.: Astrol., of planets, Ptol. Tetr. 20.—Rare in Att.
muliebria pati, prob. in Phld. Herc. 312.4.
having borne a girl, Lyc. 851.
making weak, of the number 8, Nicom. ap. Phot. Bibl. p.144 B.

definition: θηλύπους, ποδος, ὁ, ἡ, θ. βάσις

children.definition: of female foot, [ E.] IA 421.
befitting a woman, ποικίλματα Agath. 3.28; womanish, οἰνοχόοι AP 12.175 ( Strat.), cf. Chor. Lyd. 7: metaph., θεότης θ., of Difference, Dam. Pr. 192.

definition: θηλύπρινος, ἡ, Arc. name for φελλός, Eust. 302.30.

children.definition: with womanʼs face, Suid. s.v. Σειρῆνας.
bracken, Pteris aquilina, Thphr. HP 9.18.8, Dsc. 4.185, Plin. HN 27.78:—also θηλυ-πτέριον, τό, Alex.Trall. Verm. p.597 P.

definition: θῆλυς, θήλεια, θῆλυ: Ep. fem. θήλεα, acc. pl. -εας Il. 5.269 ( Hom. has regul. fem. θήλεια Il. 8.7, al., but also θῆλυς as fem., 10.216, al., as in other poets, v. infr.): Ion. fem. θήλεα, θήλεαν, θηλέης, θηλέῃ, pl. θήλεαι, θηλέας, θηλέων, Hdt. and Hp.: gen. θήλυδος S. Fr. 1054; acc. fem. θηλείην dub. l. in Nic. Al. 42, neut. pl. θήλεια Arat. 1068: Ep. also θηλύτερος indicating opposition rather than comparison (cf. ἀρρέντερος) ; θηλύτεραι δὲ γυναῖκες Il. 8.520; θηλύτεραι δὲ θεαί Od. 8.324; μάτε ἐρσεναιτέραν μάτε θηλυτέραν Schwyzer 424 ( Elis, iv B.C.); in late Prose θηλύτερος, -ύτατος occur as Comp. and Sup. (v. infr. II): ( θη- ‘suckle’, cf. θῆσαι):—

children.definition: female, θήλεια θεός a goddess, Il. 8.7; Ἥρη θῆλυς ἐοῦσα being female, 19.97, cf. A. Ag. 1231, S. Tr. 1062, E. IT 621; θήλειαι ἵπποι mares, Od. 4.636, etc.; σύες θήλειαι sows, 14.16; ὄϊς θῆλυς a ewe, Il. 10.216; θήλεια μῆλα Arat. 1068; θήλεια ἔλαφος a hind, Pi. O. 3.29; θήλεα κάμηλος Hdt. 3.102; ἡ θ. ἵππος ib. 86; θ. ὄρνις S. Fr. 477; ζῷα θ. Pl. Criti. 110c; ἄπαις θήλεος γόνου without female issue, Hdt. 3.66; θῆλυς σπορά E. Hec. 659; θήλειαι γυναῖκες Id. Or. 1205; θ. κόραι Pl. Lg. 764d: with masc. nouns, ὁ θῆλυς ὀρεύς the she-mule, Arist. HA 577b22; ἄνθρωπος θῆλυς Id. PA 688b31: masc. pl., θήλεις χοροί Critias 1.8D.; but μὴ εἶναι θεοὺς ἄρρενας μηδὲ θηλείας Phld. Piet. 12.

data.quote: μὴ εἶναι θεοὺς ἄρρενας μηδὲ θηλείας

children.label: b
children.definition: ἡ θήλεα, Att. -εια, the female, Hdt. 3.109, X. Mem. 2.1.4; ἀλέκτωρ ὥστε θηλείας πέλας A. Ag. 1671 (troch.).

children.label: c
children.definition: τὸ θ. γένος the female sex, woman-kind, E. Hec. 885; τὸ θ. alone, Id. HF 536, etc.; opp. τὸ ἄρρεν, Pl. R. 454d, Arist. Metaph. 988a5; [ ἡ δεῖνα] τέτοκεν θῆλυ PTeb. 422.18 (iii A.D.), al.

children.label: d
children.definition: Thphr. HP 3.9.1; θ. κάλαμος Dsc. 1.85; θῆλυς φοῖνιξ Ach.Tat. 1.17; θῆλυ βούτομον Thphr. HP 4.10.4.

of or belonging to women, κουράων θῆλυς ἀϋτή Od. 6.122; θήλεα νοῦσος among the Scythians (cf. Ἐνάρεες), Hdt. 1.105; νόμος A. Ch. 821 (lyr.); φύσις Pl. R. 453a; χάρις APl. 16.287 ( Leont.); θ. φόνος murder by women, E. Ba. 796.
soft, gentle, θῆλυς ἐέρση Od. 5.467, Hes. Sc. 395; θ. νύξ ( = ὕπομβρος) S. Fr. 1053.

children.label: b
children.definition: ὕδωρ θ. καὶ μαλακόν Thphr. CP 2.6.3; θηλυτέρα ὀσμή ib. 6.15.4; θηλύτατον πεδίον most fruitful, Call. Fr. 296; θηλύτατον ὕδωρ of the Nile, Id. Sos. vii 5.

tender, delicate, Φοίβου θήλειαι . . παρειαί Id. Ap. 37; θῆλυς ἀπὸ χροιῆς delicate of skin, Theoc. 16.49; of temper or character, soft, yielding, weak, θῆλυς ηὕρημαι τάλας S. Tr. 1075; γυνὴ δὲ θῆλυ κἀπὶ δακρύοις ἔφυ E. Med. 928; θήλεια φρήν Ar. Lys. 708, cf. E. Andr. 181; δίαιτα θηλυτέρα ἢ κατʼ ἄνδρα Plu. Mar. 34; θηλύτατος Luc. Im. 13; παλλακὴ -υτάτη Philostr. VS 2.21.2; τὸ θῆλυ τῆς ψυχῆς effeminacy, Men. 599.

data.quote: γυνὴ δὲ θῆλυ κἀπὶ δακρύοις ἔφυ

children.definition: into which others fitted, as the female vertebra, Poll. 2.180; γίγγλυμος J. AJ 3.6.3.
feminine, θήλεα [ὀνόματα] Ar. Nu. 682; θήλεα Arist. Po. 1458a10.
Pythag., of even numbers, Plu. Aet.Gr. 2.264a, 288d.
Ptol. Tetr. 19; cf. θηλυκός 3c.

children.label: III
children.definition: θήλειαι, αἱ, kind of cheese made in Crete, Seleuc. ap. Ath. 14.650d.
of female kind, γέννα, of the daughters of Danaus, A. Pr. 855.
wear womenʼs clothes, Str. 10.3.8, 11.13.9.
womenʼs dress, Eust. 782.47.
clad in womenʼs clothes: τὸ θ. effeminacy, Eust. 10.24.
producing female children, γάμοι TAM 2(1).174 Db.
womanhood, female nature, Arist. GA 775a16; sexual characters of the female, Gal. 4.570.
womanishness, delicacy, Corn. ND 20, Plu. Crass. 32; ἡ θ. τοῦ κάλλους the womanish nature of . . , ib. 24; also, effeminacy, ἐσθήτων Id. Alc. 16 (pl.).
bear females, Hp. Genit. 7, Arist. HA 574a1, GA 765a24.
bearing of females, Arist. GA 767a35: pl., J. AJ 3.11.5.
bearing females, Arist. GA 723a27, Pol. 1335a13, Theoc. 25.125.
of womanish habit: metaph., of the planet Venus, Cat.Cod.Astr. 1.136.
like a woman, νεανίσκοι Plu. Thes. 23; πάθος AP 11.285 ( Pall.).
killing women: θηλυφόνον, τό, leopardʼs bane, Aconitum Anthora, Thphr. HP 9.18.2, Nic. Al. 41, Plin. HN 25.122, Dsc. 4.76 (v.l. θηρο-).
effeminate, Ar. Ec. 110 (= Trag.Adesp. 51), Vett.Val. 104.21.
with womanʼs voice, Ael. NA 6.19; εὐγενὴς φιλοσοφία φεύγουσα τὸ θ. Eust. 10.22.
with womanʼs hand, Eust. 550.37.
with womanʼs frock, AP 6.219 ( Antip.), Orac. ap. Luc. Alex. 27.

definition: θηλυχοίρα, ἡ, = ὕαινα, Sch. Opp. H. 5.31.

children.definition: of womanʼs spirit, Ptol. Tetr. 162.
wet-nurse, Hsch.;= Lat. Rumina, Plu. Aet.Gr. 2.278d.
tomb, S. Fr. 541.

children.label: II
children.definition: = prooemium, Gloss.
collect in a heap, shortd. from θημωνολογέω (metri.gr.), ψαμμίτην δόρπον AP 9.551 ( Antiphil.).
heap, ἠΐων θημῶνα . . καρφαλέων Od. 5.368; θ. ἀχύρων Arist. Mete. 344a26; θημῶνα νηῆσαι Opp. H. 4.496, cf. Ph. ap. Eus. PE 8.7: pl., Ph. 2.97.
θ. ἅλωνος LXX Jb. 5.26; συνήγαγον αὐτοὺς θημωνιὰς θημωνιάς ib. Ex. 8.14(10), cf. Eust. 1539.16:— also θειμωνείαι and θημονιαί, Hsch.
put in a heap, Sch. Theoc. 10.46.

definition: θην, enclit. Particle ( A.D. Conj. 257.9) chiefly Ep. and Dor., rare in Trag., A. Pr. 928:—

children.definition: in truth, I ween, freq. ironical, λείψετέ θ. νέας Il. 13.620; ὥς θ. καὶ σὸν ἐγὼ λύσω μένος 17.29, cf. 21.568; strengthd., ἦ θ. in very truth, 11.365, 13.813; οὔ θ. surely not, 2.276, Od. 5.211; οὔ θ. δή 3.352; καὶ γάρ θ. Il. 21.568: coupled with γα, Epich. 34, Sophr. 24: freq. in Theoc., 1.97, al.; once in Call., Aet. Oxy. 2079.46 [Fr. 17.5 Pf. (?)].

data.quote: ὥς θ. καὶ σὸν ἐγὼ λύσω μένος

children.definition: Hsch.; θήξει, = Lat. momento, Gloss.; but κατὰ θῆξιν is f.l. for κατὰ θίξιν in Archig. ap. Gal. 12.577.

definition: θηοῖο, Ep. for θεῷο, 2 sg. pres. opt. of θηέομαι.
θῇος, α, ον, Dor. for θεῖος (A), Callicr. ap. Stob. 4.28.17, Euryph. ap. eund. 4.39.27.

children.definition: to be astonished, Hsch.
deceiver, Hsch.
deceive, Hippon. 14.1; but also, = θαυμάζω, Hsch.; cf. θηπέω.

definition: θήρ, θηρός, Ep. dat. pl. θήρεσσι, ὁ: later also ἡ, Ael. NA 6.24, etc.: (v. sub fin.):—

children.definition: beast of prey, esp. a lion (so used in Cephallenia, Sch. Il. 15.324), Il. 15.586, etc.; ὁ Νέμειος θ. E. HF 153: coupled with λέων, ib. 465, Epimenid. 2: with λέαινα, AP 14.63.4 ( Mesom.); of the wild boar, Ἐρυμάνθιος θ. S. Tr. 1097; of Cerberus, Id. OC 1569 (lyr.); ὁ θ., of a hind, Id. El. 572: pl., generally, beasts, opp. birds and fishes, ἠέ που ἐν πόντῳ φάγον ἰσθύες, ἢ ἐπὶ χέρσου θηρσὶ καὶ οἰωνοῖσιν ἕλωρ γένετʼ Od. 24.291; ἰχθύσι μὲν καὶ θηρσὶ καὶ οἰωνοῖς πετεηνοῖς Hes. Op. 277; ἐν θηρσίν, ἐν βροτοῖσιν, ἐν θεοῖς ἄνω S. Fr. 941.12; ἐν ἄγρῃ θηρῶν Hdt. 3.129; ἄφοβοι θῆρες S. Aj. 366: metaph., θῆρες ξιφήρεις, of Orestes and Pylades, E. Or. 1272, cf. Ph. 1296 (lyr.); ἡ σφοδρότης . . θηρός (sc. Ἔρωτος) Alex. 245.12: prov., ἔγνω θὴρ θῆρα Arist. Rh. 1371b16.

data.quote: ἠέ που ἐν πόντῳ φάγον ἰσθύες, ἢ ἐπὶ χέρσου θηρσὶ καὶ οἰωνοῖσιν ἕλωρ γένετʼ
ἰχθύσι μὲν καὶ θηρσὶ καὶ οἰωνοῖς πετεηνοῖς
ἐν θηρσίν, ἐν βροτοῖσιν, ἐν θεοῖς ἄνω

children.definition: living creature, πλωτοὶ θῆρες, i.e. dolphins, Arion 1.5; of vermin killed by birds, Ar. Av. 1064 (lyr.); of gnats, AP 5.150 ( Mel.); of the sacred animals in Egypt, ἀρχιστολιστὴς θηρῶν Sammelb. 4011.4.

monster, as the Sphinx, A. Th. 558 codd.; esp. of a centaur, S. Tr. 556, 568 (cf. φήρ); of Satyrs, E. Cyc. 624; οὐ θεῶν τις οὐδʼ ἄνθρωπος οὐδὲ θ. A. Eu. 70.—Less freq. than θηρίον in Prose, but found in Hdt. l.c. (v.l. θηρίων), X. Cyr. 4.6.4, Pl. R. 559d, Sph. 235a, Ael. l.c., etc.; ἄγριοι θῆρες Arist. EE 1229a25. (I.-E. ĝhṷēr-, cf. φήρ, Lith. žvėrìs ‘wild beast’.)
Thera, Pi. P. 4.20, etc.:—hence Θήρᾱθε, from Thera, Abh.Berl.Akad. 1925(5).20: Θήρανδε, to Thera, ib. 21.

hunting of wild beasts, the chase, βάν ῥʼ ἴμεν ἐς θήρην Od. 19.429; αἵμονα θήρης Il. 5.49; ἰέναι ἐπὶ τὴν θήρην Hdt. 1.37, 4.114, cf. Ar. Fr. 2 D.; ζῶσι ἀπὸ θ. Hdt. 4.22, cf. Arist. Pol. 1256a35; ἐποίησε μεγάλην θήραν X. Cyr. 1.4.14; θ. ποιεῖσθαι Arist. HA 541a20; τὰς θ. τῶν ὀρτύγων ἐποιοῦντο D.S. 1.60; τοῦ πτηνοῦ γένους θ., = ὀρνιθευτική, Pl. Sph. 220b; ἡ περὶ θάλατταν θ. fishing, Id. Lg. 823d; κυνηγεσία καὶ ἡ ἄλλη θ. ib. 763b: pl., πέρδικες εἰς τὰς θ. ἀγόμεναι, of decoy birds, Arist. GA 751a14, cf. Phld. Ir. p.42 W., Ant.Lib. 41.2.

children.label: b
children.definition: στρατηγὸς ἐπὶ τὴν θ. τῶν ἐλεφάντων OGI 82, 86 (iii B.C.), cf. Str. 16.4.5, 7, Wilcken Chr. 385.14 (iii B.C.), PPetr. 3p.292 (iii B.C.), etc.

data.quote: στρατηγὸς ἐπὶ τὴν θ. τῶν ἐλεφάντων

children.definition: eager pursuit of anything, θήραν . . ἔχομεν τόξων, = θηρῶμεν τὰ τόξα, S. Ph. 840; δυσμενῶν θήραν ἔχειν Id. Aj. 564; θ. ἀνθρώπων Pl. Sph. 222b, 222c; τοῦ ἡδέος Id. Grg. 500d; ἐπιστημῶν Id. Tht. 198a, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: prey, game, αἶψα δʼ ἔδωκε θεὸς μενοεικέα θήρην Od. 9.158, cf. A. Ch. 251, E. Ba. 1144; πρὶν κινεῖσθαι τὴν θ. X. Cyr. 2.4.25; θήραν καλήν, of a prisoner, S. Ph. 609: in pl., ὦ πταναὶ θῆραι, of birds, ib. 1146 (lyr.); τὴν θ. ἐπὶ τοῦ μέσου τηροῦσα watching its prey, of a spider, Arist. HA 623a13.

data.quote: αἶψα δʼ ἔδωκε θεὸς μενοεικέα θήρην

children.label: III
children.definition: hunting-ground, preserve, Ἁδριανοῦ θῆραι D.C. 69.10.

children.label: IV
children.definition: the games of the Circus, Epigr.Gr. 351.3 ( Nicaea).
hunter, E. Ba. 1020 (lyr., s.v.l.), AP 6.184 ( Zos.).
chase of wild beasts, Poll. 5.12.
for catching wild beasts or game, πέδη Ion Trag. 40: name of a hound, dub. in AP 7.304 ( Pisand.).
invented in the island Thera, Thphr. Fr. 119.
prey, spoil, E. Ba. 869 (lyr., s.v.l.), Hel. 192 (lyr.), AP 6.105 (pl., Apollonid.), Plu. Luc. 17: metaph., ἀρετὰ . . , θ. κάλλιστον βίῳ Arist. Fr. 675.
commander of two elephants, Ascl. Tact. 9, Ael. Tact. 23:—hence θηρ-αρχία, ἡ, his command, Ascl. Tact. 9.
to be hunted down, θηρεύοντες οὐ θηρασίμους γάμους A. Pr. 858.
huntress, Call. Del. 230.
to be pursued, sought eagerly, S. Ph. 116, X. Mem. 2.6.8.

children.label: II
children.definition: θηρατέον one must pursue, Id. Cyr. 2.4.10.
θηρατής, Il. 5.51, etc.; ἀνδρὸς θηρητῆρος 21.574; κοῦροι θ. 17.726.
ἴυγγα θ. ἔρωτος S. Fr. 474.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst. -ατήριον, τό, hunting implement, Hsch. s.v. ἄγκιστρον.
hunter, Ael. NA 13.12, PSI 3.222.7 (iii A.D.): metaph., θ. λόγων Ar. Nu. 358; δόξης D.L. 8.8; τῶν ἀδήλων Philostr.Jun. Im. 1.

θηρευτικός, σκύλακες Ph. 1.628 (s.v.l.), cf. Gal. Protr. 6; ἔργα Ael. NA 14.5; θ. σημεῖα signals given by the hunter, Plu. Gen.Socr. 2.593b; θ. φόρος tax for game-licence, dub. in PSI 3.222 (iii A.D.).
fit for winning, τὰ θ. τῶν φίλων the arts for winning friends, X. Mem. 2.6.33.
fond of hunting, Plu. Sollert. 2.960a, 965b.
to be caught: metaph., attainable, τὴν ἕξιν ᾗ τὰ καλὰ θ. γίγνεται τοῖς ἀνθρώποις Plb. 10.47.11; οὐδʼ ὅλως ἐπιστήμῃ θ. ὁ καιρός, ἀλλὰ δόξῃ D.H. Comp. 12; κριτήριον οὐδὲ στοχασμῷ θ. Phld. Rh. 1.167S.

data.quote: τὴν ἕξιν ᾗ τὰ καλὰ θ. γίγνεται τοῖς ἀνθρώποις
οὐδʼ ὅλως ἐπιστήμῃ θ. ὁ καιρός, ἀλλὰ δόξῃ

children.definition: instrument of the chase, net, trap, etc., X. Mem. 2.1.4, 3.11.7, Plu. Sollert. 2.961c (pl.), Ael. NA 1.21: pl., of spiderʼs webs, (Max.Tyr. 16.5: metaph., prob. in Lib. Decl. 22.25.
θηρατήρ, θηρήτορας ἄνδρας Il. 9.544; [ κύων] θηράτωρ Nic. Dam. 56J.

definition: θηράφιον [ ᾱ], τό, Dim. of θηρίον, of insects, Damocr. ap. Gal. 14.91.

θηράω, fut. -άσω [ᾱ] S. Ph. 958, E. IT 1426, X. An. 4.5.24, etc.: aor. ἐθήρᾱσα A. Pers. 233, E. Ba. 1215, X. Cyr. 1.4.10: pf. τεθήρᾱκα ib. 2.4.16; Thess. pf. part. πεφειράκοντες IG 9(2).536:— Med., fut. θηράσομαι (which, acc. to Moer., is the true Att. fut.) E. Ba. 228, IT 1324: aor. ἐθηρᾱσάμην S. Ph. 1007, E. Hipp. 919:— Pass., fut. -ᾱθήσομαι Gp. 12.9.2: aor. ἐθηράθην (v. infr. III): ( θήρ, θήρα):—

children.definition: hunt, chase, λαγώς, σφῆκας, X. An. l.c., HG 4.2.12, etc.; καί μʼ οὓς ἐθήρων πρόσθε θηράσουσι νῦν S. Ph. 958; of fishermen, catch, Arist. Fr. 76: metaph., catch or capture, καί σʼ εἷλε θηρῶνθʼ ἡ τύχη S. OC 1026, cf. Ph. 1007, X. An. 5.1.9: captivate, Id. Mem. 2.6.28, 3.11.7; θ. πόλιν seek to destroy it, A. Pers. 233.

data.quote: καί μʼ οὓς ἐθήρων πρόσθε θηράσουσι νῦν
καί σʼ εἷλε θηρῶνθʼ ἡ τύχη

children.definition: hunt after a thing, pursue it eagerly, τυραννίδα S. OT 542; θηρᾶν οὐ πρέπει τἀμήχανα Id. Ant. 92; μυρίαι κόραι θηρῶσι λέκτρον τοὐμόν E. IA 960; ἥμαρτον ἢ θηρῶ τι; have I missed or do I hit the quarry? A. Ag. 1194; τί χρῆμα θηρῶν; E. Supp. 115; reach, attain to, τι Pi. I. 4(3).46 (s.v.l.).
inf., seek, endeavour to do, θηρᾷ γαμεῖν με E. Hel. 63; cf. II.3.
θηρήτω δὲ ἁ θοιναρμόστρια IG 5(1).1498 ( Messenia, ii B.C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Med. like Act., hunt for, fish for, ἐγχέλεις Ar. Eq. 864: abs., οἱ θηρώμενοι hunters, X. Cyn. 11.2.

seek after, ἐμέτοισι θηρώμενοι τὴν ὑγιείην Hdt. 2.77; μαστοῖς ἔλεον θ. E. Or. 568; τὴν τῆς σωφροσύνης δόξαν D. 61.21, etc.; θ. πυρὸς πηγήν find, discover it, A. Pr. 109; expect to derive, τι παρά τινων Phld. Rh. 1.263S.
inf., seek, endeavour, ὅς με θηρᾶται λαβεῖν E. Hel. 545; πεῖράν τινʼ ἐχθρῶν ἁρπάσαι θηρώμενον S. Aj. 2.

children.label: III
children.definition: Pass., to be hunted, pursued, πρὸς ἄτης θηραθεῖσαι A. Pr. 1072; ὑπʼ ἀνδρῶν E. Ba. 732; Ἀλκιβιάδης διὰ κάλλος ὑπὸ γυναικῶν θηρώμενος X. Mem. 1.2.24.—Cf. θηρεύω.

data.quote: Ἀλκιβιάδης διὰ κάλλος ὑπὸ γυναικῶν θηρώμενος

children.definition: hunting, Gloss.

definition: θήρειος, ον, also α, ον v.l. in Pl. Phdr. 248d, AP 5.265 ( Paul.Sil.): ( θήρ):—

children.definition: of wild beasts, δέρμα θ. λέοντος Panyas. 1, cf. Hanno Peripl. 9; μέλεα Emp. 101; θήρειον γραφήν the figures of animals worked upon the cloak, A. Ch. 232; θ. δάκος,= θήρ, E. Cyc. 325; θ. βία, periphr. for ὁ θήρ, the centaur, S. Tr. 1059; θ. κρέα game, X. Cyr. 1.3.6; so θήρεια, τά, Hp. Aff. 52; θ. φύσις Pl. l.c.; θ. αὐλός ( ἐκ νεβροῦ κώλων εἰργασμένος) Poll. 4.75.

children.label: II
children.definition: θ. στόματα the entrance of the Circus, IG 4.365 ( Corinth).
charming wild beasts, Suid. s.v. σοφός.
spoil, prey, S. Ichn. 285, E. IA 1162.

children.label: II
children.definition: hunting, Pl. Lg. 823b.
hunting, the chase, πεζῶν Pl. Lg. 824a: metaph., ὀνομάτων θηρεύσεις Id. Tht. 166c.
one must hunt after, Plb. 1.35.8.

definition: θηρευτήρ, ῆρος, ὁ, = sq., Opp. C. 1.449.

children.definition: hunter, used by Hom. (only in Il.) always as Adj., κύνεσσι καὶ ἀνδράσι θηρευτῇσιν hounds and huntsmen, Il. 12.41; ἐν κυσὶ θηρευτῇσι 11.325; so θ. ἄνδρες Hes. Sc. 303, 388; κύνες Thgn. 1254, X. Ages. 9.6: as Subst., Hdt. 1.123, Satyr. Vit.Eur.Fr. 39 XXi 14; of a fisher, Hdt. 2.70; θ. πέρδιξ a decoy partridge, Arist. HA 614a10; θ. ἰξός birdlime, AP 5.99.
θ. νέων καὶ πλουσίων Pl. Sph. 231d, cf. Chor. p.67 B. [26.2.59]; καλλίστων ὀνομάτων Ath. 3.122c.
of of for hunting, κύνες θ. hounds, Ar. Pl. 157, X. Lac. 6.3; βίος θ. the life of hunters, Arist. Pol. 1256b2: ἡ -κή (sc. τέχνη) hunting, the chase, Pl. Plt. 289a, cf. Sph. 223b.
hunting after, τῆς τροφῆς Arist. HA 488a19: metaph., θ. τέχνη ἀνθρώπων Pl. Euthd. 290b.
Arist. Pol. 1324b40.
θηρευτήρ, βοῦς PCair.Zen. 292.298 (iii B.C.), cf. Hsch. s.v. θηρότις; θ. κύνες Them. Or. 18.220b.
hunter, θ. ἄνδρες, of men engaged in Circus games, IG 4.365 ( Corinth).

definition: θηρεύω, aor. 1 ἐθήρευσα Pl. Euthd. 290c: pf. τεθήρευκα Id. Tht. 200a:— Med., fut. -σομαι Id. Sph. 222a: aor. ἐθηρευσάμην Ar. Fr. 51, Pl. Tht. 197d:— Pass., pf. τεθήρευμαι Lysipp.Com. 7: aor. ἐθηρεύθην Hdt. 3.102, A. Ch. 493, Pl. Sph. 221a: (cf. θηράω):—

children.definition: hunt, θηρεύοντα while hunting, Od. 19.465, cf. Hdt. 4.112; θηρεύειν διὰ κενῆς, of the motions of the hands of dying persons, Hp. Prog. 4.
decoy, Arist. HA 614a13.

children.label: II
children.definition: hunt after, chase, catch, ἀττελέβους Hdt. 4.172; θηρία, ὄρνιθας ἀγρίας, μῦν, X. An. 1.2.7, Pl. Tht. 197c, PCair.Zen. 300.7 (iii B.C.); ἰχθῦς Arist. HA 603a7; [ ἐλέφαντας] OGI 54.11 ( Adule, iii B.C.); of men, Hdt. 4.183; θ. ἀνθρώπους ἐπὶ θοίνην ἤ θυσίαν Arist. Pol. 1324b39, cf. X. An. 1.2.13; Τιτυὸν βέλος θήρευσε it hit, struck him, Pi. P. 4.90:— Med., Ar. Fr. 51, Pl. Grg. 464d, Euthd. 290b:— Pass., to be hunted, Hdt. 3.102; to be preyed upon, ib. 108; to be caught, πέδαις A. Ch. 493: metaph., to be captivated, Lysipp.Com. 7.

data.quote: θ. ἀνθρώπους ἐπὶ θοίνην ἤ θυσίαν

children.definition: hunt, seek after, κερδέων μέτρον Pi. N. 11.47; γάμους A. Pr. 858; ἀρετάν E. IA 568 (lyr.); θ. νέους πλουσίους ὀρφανούς Aeschin. 1.170; ἡδονάς, ἐπιστήμην, Isoc. 1.16, Pl. Tht. 200a, al.; [ εὐδαιμονίαν] Arist. Pol. 1328b1; ὀνόματα, ῥήματα, Pl. Grg. 489b, And. 1.9, cf. Antipho 6.18; τὰς ἀρχὰς τῶν συλλογισμῶν Arist. APr. 46a11; θ. τὸν πλησίον, of an orator, Phld. Rh. 2.5 S., al.—Trag. preferred θηράω, exc. where metre demanded θηρεύω.

definition: θήρημα, θηρητήρ, θηρ-ήτειρα, θηρ-ήτωρ, Ion. for θήρᾱμα, etc.

children.definition: pass into a beast, of the soul, Corp.Herm. 10.20.

concerning venomous beasts, λόγος Dsc. Ther. Praef.; Φιλῖνος <ὁ> θ., the writer on this subject, Philum. Ven. 6.1: ἡ -κή (sc. ἀντίδοτος) and antidote against a poisonous bite, Androm. ap. Gal. 14.32, etc.; θ. φάρμακα Id. 17(2).337; θηριακά, title of Nicanderʼs poem on such antidotes; of other works, Gal. 14.7; θ. ἄμπελος Gp. 4.8.1, cf. Plin. HN 14.117; θ. [οἶνος] Dsc. 5.53.
capture of wild beasts, Sm. Ge. 49.9.
caught by wild beasts, LXX Le. 5.2, Ph. 2.355.

definition: θηρίαμβος, coined as etym. of θρίαμβος, Suid.

children.definition: beast-man, ἔθνος Hdn. Epim. 76.
Dim. of θηρίον, in pl., animalculae, Thphr. HP 2.8.3, Arr. Epict. 2.9.6, Gal. 16.162, Gp. 5.53.6.

definition: Θηρίκλειος, α, ον, or ος, ον,

children.definition: made by Thericles, a famous Corinthian potter ( Eub. 31, 43), Θ. κύλιξ Alex. 96, Thphr. HP 5.3.2 (pl.), Cleanth.Stoic. 1.133; κρατήρ Alex. 119, cf. IG ΙΙ(2).124.43, al. ( Delos, iii B.C.); ποτήρια Phalar. Ep. 70; freq. Θηρικλεία (or -ος) alone, Alex. 5, Men. 226, 324; Θ. ἡ μεγάλη Diox. 4; τῶν Θηρικλείων εὐκύκλωτον ἀσπίδα Aristopho 14; ὅσα δʼ ἐστὶν εἴδη Θηρικλείων τῶν καλῶν Dionys.Com. 5.1.

data.quote: ὅσα δʼ ἐστὶν εἴδη Θηρικλείων τῶν καλῶν

children.definition: exhibitors of wild beasts, Antioch.Astr. in Cat.Cod.Astr. 7.118, 8(4).212.
bite of a serpent, Dsc. 2.79.
marsus, Gloss.
bitten by a wild beast, esp. by a serpent, Damocr. ap. Gal. 14.122, Dsc. 1.103, 4.24.
like a wild beast, Adam. 1.4.
keeper of wild beasts, Procop. Arc. 9.
θηροκτόνος, φάρμακον Eust. 1416.14.
fight with wild beasts, D.S. 3.43, 1 Ep.Cor. 15.32, Vett.Val. 129.33, Ptol. Tetr. 200, Artem. 2.54.
one who fights with beasts, D.S. 36.10.
fighting with wild beasts, in pl., = Lat. venationes, Str. 2.5.33, Ph. 1.602.
fighting with wild beasts, M.Ant. 10.8, Luc. Lex. 19.
half man half beast, as Scylla, Tz.ad Lyc. 45.
in the form of a beast, κώδων Eust. 1139.57, cf. Procl. Par.Ptol. 278.

definition: θηρίον, τό (in form Dim. of θήρ),

children.definition: wild animal, esp. of such as are hunted, μάλα γὰρ μέγα θηρίον ἦεν, of a stag, Od. 10.171, 180 (never in Il.); in Trag. only in Satyric drama, S. Ichn. 147 (dub. in A. Fr. 26): used in Prose for θήρ, X. An. 1.2.7, Isoc. 12.163, etc.; of the spiderʼs prey, Arist. HA 623a27; freq. of elephants, Plb. 11.1.12, al.: pl., beasts, opp. men, birds, and fishes, h.Ven. 4, Hdt. 3.108.

animal, Id. 1.119; νενόμισται πῦρ θ. εἶναι ἔμψυχον Id. 3.16; of men, ἄνθρωπος πάντων θ. θεειδέστατον Antipho Soph. 48; εἰς θηρίου βίον ἀφικνεῖσθαι Pl. Phdr. 249b; also θ. ὕειον Id. R. 535e; of the dog, Theoc. 25.79; of fishes, Arist. HA 598b1; of eels, Antiph. 147.7; of leeches, IG 4.951.101 (Epid.); of other small creatures, Arist. HA 552b11, 625b32, Hp. ap. Gal. 19.103, Theoc. 19.6; οὐκ ἔστιν οὐδὲν θ. τῶν ἰχθύων ἀτυχέστερον Antiph. 161.1; opp. plants, Pl. Smp. 188b: prov., ἢ θηρίον ἢ θεός, either above or below the nature of man, Arist. Pol. 1253a29, cf. EN 1145a25.

data.quote: οὐκ ἔστιν οὐδὲν θ. τῶν ἰχθύων ἀτυχέστερον

children.definition: beast, esp. as hostile and odious to man, θηρία τε καὶ βοτά carnivora and graminivora, Pl. Mx. 237d; monster, creature, of sharks, etc., Hdt. 6.44; of Typhon, etc., Pl. Phdr. 230a, R. 588e; of the Satyrs, S. Ichn. l.c.; ταυτὶ ποδαπὰ τὰ θ.; Ar. Nu. 184, cf. Av. 93.

children.label: b
children.definition: poisonous animal, Dsc. 1.75, Act.Ap. 28.4.

children.label: II
children.definition: θηρίωμα, Hp. Coac. 459, Loc.Hom. 29, cf. Gal. l.c.

children.label: III
children.definition: beast, creature, ὦ δειλότατον σὺ θηρίον Ar. Pl. 439, cf. Eq. 273; κόλακι, δεινῷ θηρίῳ Pl. Phdr. 240b; Κρῆτες, κακὰ θ. Epimenid. 1; δυσνουθέτητον θ., of poverty, Men. Georg. 78; ἡ μουσικὴ ἀεί τι καινὸν θηρίον τίκτει Anaxil. 27, cf. Eup. 132; τί δέ, εἰ αὐτοῦ τοῦ θηρίου ἠκούσατε; said by Aeschines of Demosthenes, Plin. Ep. 2.3.10; θ. συνεστιώμενον, of woman, Secund. Sent. 8.

data.quote: ἡ μουσικὴ ἀεί τι καινὸν θηρίον τίκτει

children.label: IV
children.definition: Lupus, Eudox. ap. Hipparch. 1.2.20, Vett.Val. 6.13.
that benumbs serpents, Nerium Oleander, Plin. HN 24.163, 25.113.
struck by a poisonous animal, Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(4).150.
make into wild beasts, Tz.ad Lyc. 815.
brutality, Arist. EN 1145a17, Metop. ap. Stob. 3.1.115.
park where wild beasts are kept, Hortens. in Varro RR 3.13.2 ( thero- codd.).
train as a wild beast, Alciphr. Fr. 5 ( Pass.).
abounding in wild beasts, of a country, Str. 2.5.33; keeping wild beasts, Procl. Par.Ptol. 250.

children.label: II
children.definition: θηριότροφος, ον, Pass., fed on reptiles, Gal. 11.143.
make into a wild beast, τοὺς πρὸς αὐτὴν ἀφικνουμένους ἡ Κίρκη θηριοῖ Phld. Piet. 144:— Pass., IG 14.1291.

data.quote: τοὺς πρὸς αὐτὴν ἀφικνουμένους ἡ Κίρκη θηριοῖ

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., come to the full size of a beast, πρὶν θηριοῦσθαι τὸν γόνον Eub. 107.14.
become brutal, θηριούμενος Pl. Lg. 935a; πρός τινας Phld. Lib. p.25O.; πρὸς ἀγριότητα Ph. 2.53.
to be infested with worms, Thphr. CP 5.18.1.

children.label: b
children.definition: to be infested with reptiles, Paul.Aeg. 5.1.
become malignant, ἕλκη ἐᾶσαι θηριωθῆναι Thphr. Char. 19.3; τεθηριωμένον ἕλκος Dsc. 3.9.

definition: Θηρίτας, α, ὁ, Lacon. name of Ares, Paus. 3.19.8, Hsch. ( Lacon. for Θερσίτης).

children.definition: full of wild beasts, infested by them, of countries, ἡ θ. Λιβύη Hdt. 4.181; ὄρεα -έστατα Id. 1.110; ἐν τῇ θ. [χώρῃ] Id. 4.174, cf. 2.32; -εστάτης ἐούσης τῆς θαλάσσης ταύτης full of ravenous fishes, Id. 6.44.

children.label: II
children.definition: savage, Arist. PA 663a13; ἐπὶ τὸ -έστερον Id. HA 502b4; τὸ θ., of a colt, E. Tr. 671.

brutal, δίαιτα Hp. VM 3; [ βίοτος] E. Supp. 202, cf. SIG 704 E 11 ( Delph., ii B.C.); ἡδονή Pl. R. 591c; βρίμωσις Phld. Ir. p.58W.; κατάστασις OGI 424.3 ( Palestine, i A.D.); ὁ θ. ἐν τοῖς ἀνθρώποις σπάνιος Arist. EN 1145a30; οἱ Λάκωνες . . θηριώδεις ἀπεργάζονται [τοὺς παῖδας] Id. Pol. 1338b12; ἡ θ. ἕξις Id. EN 1145a24: Comp. -έστερος, ἄνθρωπος Plb. 30.12.3; τὸ θ. brutality, Pl. Cra. 394e, al. Adv. -ωδῶς, διακεῖσθαι πρὸς ἀλλήλους Isoc. 11.25, cf. Plb. 15.20.3.

data.quote: ὁ θ. ἐν τοῖς ἀνθρώποις σπάνιος

children.definition: ζῴδια θ.,= θηριόμορφα, Ptol. Tetr. 200.

children.label: III
children.definition: malignant, of ulcers, Phld. Ir. p.44W., Dsc. 2.108, Plu. Superst. 2.165e, Aret. SA 2.8; also of intestinal worms, Hp. Epid. 6.1.11, 6.2.11.

definition: θηριωδία, ἡ, = θηριότης, v.l. in Arist. EN 1145a24, cf. Sch. E. Or. 518 (written θηρῐ-ώδεια Asp. in EN 130.7).

children.definition: malignant ulcer (cf. θηρίον II), Cels. 5.28.3, Dsc. 2.109, Erot. s.v. τὸ θηριῶδες, Gal. 17(1).948.
named after a wild beast, Eust.ad D.P. 976.
turning into a beast, Luc. Salt. 48.
slay wild beasts, S. Ph. 165 (anap.), v.l. in AP 6.186 ( Diocl.).
eaten or torn by wild beasts, κρέας Ps. Phoc. 147; θ. θάνατος death by wild beasts, Man. 4.614.
where wild beasts feed, ἐρημοσύνη AP 9.4 ( Cyllen.), cf. Phalar. Ep. 34.
heralded by the roar of wild beasts, epith. of Hecate, Orph. H. 1.6.
stung by a serpent, Sch. S. Ph. 696.
taming, training of wild beasts, Man. 4.245.
hunter, Choerob. in Theod. 1.296, EM 451.23.
having the forms of wild beasts, Hsch.
hunter, Hsch.
with brutal mind, brutal, APl. 16.25 ( Phil.).
keeper of a wild animal, Hld. 10.27.3.
killing wild beasts, epith. of Heracles, IG 5(2).91 ( Tegea); of Artemis, E. IA 1570, Corn. ND 3, Porph. Abst. 1.22; ἐν φοναῖς θ. in the chase, E. Hel. 154.
word-chaser, Hsch.
destroy wild beasts, Eust. 561.3, Dosith. p.432 K.
slayer of beasts, Hsch.; ὄζος ὁ θ., of the club of Heracles, APl. 16.104 ( Phil.):—fem. θηρ-ολέτις, ιδος, cj. for θηρότις, Hsch.
venatio, Mon.Anc.Gr. 19.7, OGI 533.48 ( Ancyra), IGRom. 3.631 ( Xanthus).
half-beast, φῦλα θ., of centaurs, Opp. C. 2.6; θ. τις ὠρυγή a cry as of beasts, Plu. Mar. 20.
δαίμων Lyc. 963.
feeding or tending wild beasts, of a mountain, AP 6.111 ( Antip.); of Pan, Castorio 2.
guiding them, μάστιξ Nonn. D. 11.122.
clad in the skins of beasts, Orph. H. 69.7; θ. μανία the mad fancy of wearing skins, Cerc. 10, Stratonic. ap. Timae. 80.
to make beasts, Tz.ad Lyc. 673.
changing into beasts, of Circe, Lyc. 673.
looking out for wild beasts, epith. of Artemis, h.Hom. 27.11, B. 10.107, AP 6.240 ( Phil.).
the chase, Opp. C. 4.43 (pl.), AP 6.167 ( Agath.).
producing beasts, ἄγκεα AP 6.186 ( Diocl.).
Aristaenet. 2.20.
feeding wild beasts, ἀνήρ IGRom. 4.826 ( Hierapolis); of places, E. Ba. 556 (lyr.), A.R. 4.1561, Longus 1.1; of Tethys, Orph. H. 22.6.

children.label: II
children.definition: θηρότροφος, Pass., feeding on beasts, δράκων E. Ph. 820 (hex.).
in the form of a beast, Orph. H. 24.5, 39.8.
appearing like a beast, Procl.ad Hes. Op. 151.
slayer of beasts, Opp. C. 1.538.
slay beasts, Opp. C. 4.24.

definition: θηροφόνος, ον, also η, ον Thgn. 11, prob. in Ar. Th. 320:—

children.definition: killing wild beasts, epith. of Artemis, Thgn. l.c., Ar. l.c.; θεά E. HF 378 (lyr.); of Apollo, AP 9.525.9; θεός, i.e. Hadrian, Pancrat. Oxy. 1085.31; κύνες E. Hipp. 216 (anap.).

children.label: II
children.definition: θ., τό, v.l. for θηλυφόνον, Dsc. 4.76.
producing game, prob. l. AP 14.24.
huntsman, PPetr. 3p.321 (iii B.C.), Sammelb. 286.3.
clad in the skins of beasts, Lyc. 871.
serf, bondsman, θῆτές τε δμῶές τε Od. 4.644; later, hired labourer, θῆτά τʼ ἄοικον ποιεῖσθαι Hes. Op. 602; μισθωτοὺς καὶ θῆτας Pl. Plt. 290a; βάναυσοι καὶ θ. (opp. δοῦλοι) Arist. Pol. 1278a13.

children.label: II
children.definition: θῆσσα, later Att. θῆττα, ἡ, hired servant-girl, opp. ἐπίκληρος, Posidipp. 35; θ. γυνή A.R. 1.193, cf. Ant.Lib. 25.3.
Adj., = θητική, θῆσσα τράπεζα menial fare, E. Alc. 2; θ. ἑστία Id. El. 205 (lyr.).

suckle, Hsch.; elsewh. Med., suck; Hom. has pres. inf., ἀλλʼ αἰεὶ παρέχουσιν ἐπηετανὸν γάλα θῆσθαι they give milk to suck the year round, Od. 4.89: aor. 1, θήσατο μαζόν he sucked the breast, Il. 24.58, cf. Call. Jov. 48; part., θησάμενος having sucked, h.Cer. 236; γάλα Call. Sos. vii. 4; but,

children.label: II
children.definition: suckle, Ἀπόλλωνα θήσατο μήτηρ h.Ap. 123. (I.-E. dhē- ‘suck’, cf. θηλή, θῆλυς, Lett. dēt ‘suck’, Skt. dháyati, Goth. daddjan ‘suckle’, Lat. fēlare, filius.)

store, treasure up, ἐν ἀσφαλείῃ τὰ χρήματα θ. Hdt. 2.121.αʹ; θ. τὸν νεκρὸν ἐν οἰκήματι to lay it by, ib. 86; φάρμακα, σῖτα θ. παρʼ αὑτῷ, X. Cyr. 8.2.24, etc.; of fruits, lay up in store, preserve, pickle, [ καυλοὺς] ἐν ἅλμῃ Thphr. HP 6.4.10; τὸ ἔλαιον θ. [τὰς ὀσμάς] preserves its smell, Id. CP 6.19.3:— Pass., ῥὰξ εὖ τεθησαυρισμένη S. Fr. 398.2; [ ἡ ἐβένη] τὴν χρόαν οὐ -ομένη λαμβάνει τὴν εὔχρουν ἀλλʼ εὐθὺς τῇ φύσει Thphr. HP 4.4.6, cf. 3.12.5; ἡ τεθησαυρισμένη τῶν ἀρωμάτων ἀπόλαυσις Agatharch. 97; τὸ θησαυρισθέν IG 14.423 ii 37 ( Tauromenium).

data.quote: ἡ ἐβένη] τὴν χρόαν οὐ -ομένη λαμβάνει τὴν εὔχρουν ἀλλʼ εὐθὺς τῇ φύσει

children.label: b
children.definition: hoard, lay up treasure, Phld. Oec. p.71J., Ep.Jac. 5.3; ἑαυτῷ Ev.Luc. 12.21.

θ. σεαυτῷ ὀργήν Ep.Rom. 2.5; θ. θησαυροὺς ἐν οὐρανῷ Ev.Matt. 6.20; θ. εὐτυχίαν lay up a store of . . , App. Sam. 4.3:— Med., store up for oneself, ἑαυτῷ ὑπομνήματα Pl. Phdr. 276d, cf. Isoc. 15.229:— Pass., τεθησαυρισμένος κατά τινος φθόνος D.S. 20.36; χάριτας -ισθησομένας Id. 1.90; to be reserved, πυρί 2 Ep.Pet. 3.7.
of the public granary, μέτρον PLips. 97v7 (iv A.D.).
θησαυρικόν, τό, charge for use of granary, PRyl. 213.3 (ii A.D.), al.
store, treasure, S. Ph. 37, E. El. 497, Ion 1394, Vett.Val. 352.5: metaph., θ. κακῶν Democr. 149.
laying up in store, χρημάτων Arist. Pol. 1256b28, cf. Phld. Oec. p.71 J.; preservation, keeping, ὀσμῶν Thphr. Od. 14, cf. HP 8.11.1; θ. φαντασιῶν, definition of memory, Zeno Stoic. 1.19.
one must store up, τὸ πλεονάζον τοῦ καρποῦ Ph. 2.57.
one who lays up in store, Poll. 3.115.
accustomed to lay up in store, [ ζῷα] τροφῆς θησαυριστικά Arist. HA 488a20; prob.l. for θησαυρικός (= miserly), Ptol. Tetr. 158.
make stores, Poll. 3.116.
laying up in store, Pl. R. 554a.

store, treasure, Ar. Av. 599, etc.; θ. χθονός, of the silvermines of Laureion, A. Pers. 238 (troch.); θ. εὑρεῖν Arist. Pol. 1303b35; ἄνθρακες ὁ θ., prov., ‘apples of Sodom’, freq. in Luc. Zeux. 2, al.; σποδὸς οἱ θ. γενήσονται Alciphr. 2.3.13: metaph., θ. γλώσσης φειδωλῆς Hes. Op. 719; θ. ὕμνων Pi. P. 6.8; κακῶν E. Ion 923, cf. Hp. Lex; κόμας . . , ἱκτήριον θ. S. Aj. 1175; Διὸς θ., of a tomb marking the fall of a thunderbolt, E. Supp. 1010; οἰωνοῖς γλυκὺν θ., of a dead body, S. Ant. 30; of learning, θ., οὓς κατέλιπον ἐν βιβλίοις X. Mem. 1.6.14; σοφίας θ. Pl. Phlb. 15e, Ep.Col. 2.3; χρημάτων καὶ τιμῶν Pl. Mx. 247b; καλὸς θ. παρʼ ἀνδρὶ σπουδαίῳ χάρις Isoc. 1.29; ἐκ τοῦ ἀγαθοῦ θ. τῆς καρδίας Ev.Luc. 6.45.

data.quote: καλὸς θ. παρʼ ἀνδρὶ σπουδαίῳ χάρις
ἐκ τοῦ ἀγαθοῦ θ. τῆς καρδίας

children.label: II
children.definition: strong-room, magazine, Hdt. 2.150, SIG 419.17 ( Delph., iii B.C.), LXX De. 32.34, etc.; esp. of the treasuries built at Delphi by Greek cities, SIG 8 (vi B.C.), Hdt. 1.14, al., X. An. 5.3.5, Str. 4.1.13, etc.; vaults of a bank, PLips. 62ii 14 (iv A.D.).
granary, PCair.Zen. 232.4 (iii B.C.), Wilcken Chr. 385.27 (iii B.C.), 192 (i A.D.), etc.; οἱ δημόσιοι θ. PRyl. 90.9 (iii A.D.), cf. POxy. 2119.3 (iii A.D.).
receptacle for valuables, safe, casket, Hdt. 7.190, 9.106, Ev.Matt. 2.11; θ. βελέεσσιν, of a quiver, A. Pers. 1022 (lyr.).

offertory-box (for its form, v. IG 9(2).590), IG 7.235.23 ( Oropus, iv B.C.), 12(3).443 ( Thera, iii B.C.), Jahrb. 16.162 note 13 ( Rhodes, iii B.C.), Schwyzer 89 ( Argos, iii B.C.), SIG 1015.30 (Halic.), PTeb. 6.27 (ii B.C.), IG 5(1).1390.89 ( Andania, i B.C.); σπονδεῖον ἢ θ. coin-in-the-slot machine which sold holy water, Hero Spir. 1.21.
cavern, S. Ichn. 276; subterranean dungeon, Plu. Phil. 19.
lay by, store up, ἀργύριον Ph. 2.215; μνήμας Id. 1.237:— Pass., ib. 338.

children.label: II
children.definition: to be a treasurer, D.S. 19.15.
tax levied for the protection of granaries, PTeb. 68.89,61 ( b).317 (ii B.C.).
treasury, Artem. 1.74, Them. Or. 7.91d.
treasurer, LXX Es. 5.14, D.S. 18.58, Polyaen. 4.9.4, Arr. Ind. 12.7 (pl.), Vett.Val. 85.23.

children.label: II
children.definition: guard of the state-granaries, PCair.Zen. 292.155 (iii B.C.), PTeb. 90.40 (i B.C.), POxy. 522.9 (ii A.D.).
filled with treasure, τάφοι Philostr. VA 7.23.1.
sons of Theseus, i.e. Athenians, S. OC 1066 (lyr.).

definition: θησειομύζων, sine expl., Ar. Fr. 459 ( Et.Gen.).

children.definition: temple of Theseus, a sanctuary ( ἄσυλον) for criminals and slaves, Ar. Eq. 1312, Fr. 567:—also Θησέον, Pherecr. 49 (cf. Et.Gen.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Θησεῖα, τά, festival of Theseus, Ar. Pl. 627:—also Θησέα, SIG 1029.78 (iv B.C.).

children.label: III
children.definition: θησεῖον, τό, holewort, Corydalis densiflora, Thphr. HP 7.12.3, Plin. HN 21.107.
one who is always in the Theseum, i.e. a runaway slave, Ar. Fr. 458.

definition: θησεύμεθα, Dor. fut. Med. of τίθημι.
Θησεύς, ὁ, gen. Θησέως [trisyll., S. Ph. 562, OC 1593, 1657, but disyll., ib. 1003, 1103]:—

children.definition: Theseus, Il. 1.265, etc.: pl. Θησέες Pl. Tht. 169b; Θησεῖς Alciphr. 2.4.

definition: Θησηΐς, ΐδος, contr. Θησῄς, ῆδος, fem. of Θήσειος,

children.definition: of Theseus, χθών A. Eu. 1026.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst., Theseid, a poem on Theseus, Arist. Po. 1451a20, D.L. 2.59.
Plu. Thes. 5.

children.label: II
children.definition: = Lat. tensa, sacred car, Plu. Cor. 25.

definition: θήσω ἥσω, αἰτήσω ( Boeot.), Hsch.; θησόμενοι· αἰτούμενοι, Id.; θησάμενοι· αἰτησάμενοι (Cret.), Id. (Prob. forms of θέσσασθαι, q.v.)

children.definition: the letter Θ (Hebr. ṭêth), Ar. Ec. 685, etc.: gen. θήτατος Democr. 20: nom. pl. θήτατες ( tetates) Wessely Schrifttaf. zur ält. lat. Paläogr.No. 8 (ii A.D.); nickname of Aesop (who was a θής), Ptol. Heph. ap. Phot. Bibl. p.151 B.
hired service, service, S. OT 1029, Isoc. 14.48: in pl., ib. 11.38, D.H. 2.19.
servility, sycophancy, c. gen., θ. ὄχλων ἢ δυναστῶν Epicur. Sent.Vat. 67.

definition: θητεῖον, τό, = μίσθωμα, Μυστάκου θ., title of play by Sopatros, Ath. 4.175c, al. ( θητίον codd.).

children.definition: to be a serf or labourer, Λαομέδοντι . . θητεύσαμεν εἰς ἐνιαυτόν Il. 21.444, cf. Od. 18.357; θητευέμεν ἄλλῳ, ἀνδρὶ παρʼ ἀκλήρῳ 11.489, cf. E. Alc. 6, Cyc. 77 (lyr.), Pl. Euthphr. 4c, R. 359d, Phld. Piet. 63; θ. ἐπὶ μισθῷ παρά τινι Hdt. 8.137; θ. εἰς τὸ τεῖχος labour at it, Philostr. Her. 12a. 3; θ. Παλλάδι καὶ Παφίῃ serve, AP 5.292.12 ( Paul.Sil.).
of or for a hireling, menial, ἔργον Arist. Rh. 1367a31; βάναυσος ἢ θ. βίος Id. Pol. 1278a21; -ωτέρα ργασία ib. 1341b14; θ. καὶ δουλικὸν πράττειν ib. 1337b21.

τὸ θ.,= οἱ θῆτες, the class of θῆτες, ib. 1274a21, al.; θ. τελεῖν pay on the assessment of a θής at Athens, Id. Ath. 7.4, Lex ap. D. 43.54; θ. τέλος Epigr. ap. Arist. Ath. 7.4; τὸ θ. in an army, servants, camp-followers, etc., Arr. Tact. 2.1.
like a θής, servile, πάντες οἱ κόλακες θ. Arist. EN 1125a2, cf. Luc. Fug. 12.

definition: θητόν βωμόν, Hsch. θῆττα, ἡ, v. θῆσσα.

children.definition: hire, wages, Suid.:—hence θητωνέω, receive wages, prob. in IG 2(2).1013.54.
Ἰλιόθι πρό Il. 8.561; ἠῶθι πρό 11.50.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀγρόθι, οἴκοθι, ἄλλοθι, etc., cf. A.D. Adv. 205.35, al.

definition: θιαγών, όνος, ὁ, an Aetol. sacrificial cake, Nic. Fr. 136, Hsch.
θιακχά ἄνθη ἐν Σικυῶνι, Hsch. θιάλλαι· θῆμνες, Id. θιάρατος (i.e. Θεάρατος) · εὐκτός, Id. θιᾱρός,

children.definition: θιάσαι· χορεῦσαι, Id.
to be leader of a θίασος, OGI 529.5 (Sebastopolis, ii A.D.).
leader of a θίασος, Luc. Peregr. 11.
revel, Procl. H. 1.21.
initiate into the θίασος, Epic.Alex.Adesp. 9i2; ὅς με . . κόραις ἐθιάσευσʼ E. Ion 552; θ. χοροῖς Id. Ba. 379 (lyr.):— Pass., -εύεται ψυχάν ib. 75.

children.label: II
children.definition: celebrate Bacchic rites, Str. 12.4.3.

definition: θιασίτης [ σῑ], ου, ὁ, = θιασώτης, IG 12(5).872.60 ( Tenos), SIG 1108 ( Callatis), etc.:—fem. θῐᾰσ-ῖτις, ιδος, ἡ, Kastriotis Κατάλ. περιγραφικός, Γλυπτὰ τοῦ Ἐθνικοῦ Μους. (1908) No.1485 (pl., Nicaea, iii/iv A.D.).

children.definition: belonging to a θίασος, χρήματα SIG 1108.9 ( Callatis).
Bacchic revel, rout, Hdt. 4.79, E. Ba. 680, Ar. Ra. 156, etc.; θ. ἄγειν E. Ba. 115 (lyr.); τοὺς . . θ. ἄγων διὰ τῶν ὁδῶν τοὺς ἐστεφανωμένους τῷ μαράθῳ καὶ τῇ λεύκῃ D. 18.260, cf. Ath. 5.185c, 8.362e.

data.quote: τοὺς . . θ. ἄγων διὰ τῶν ὁδῶν τοὺς ἐστεφανωμένους τῷ μαράθῳ καὶ τῇ λεύκῃ

children.definition: religious guild, confraternity, IG 2.986,1663,22.1177, SIG 1044.45 (Halic.), etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: company, troop, used by Trag. in lyr., Κενταύρων E. IA 1059; ἡλίκων Id. IT 1146; Μουσῶν Ar. Th. 41; ἐνόπλιος θ., of warriors, E. Ph. 796; Κενταυρικὸς καὶ Σατυρικός Pl. Plt. 303d; τοῦ σοῦ θ. of your company, X. Mem. 2.1.31; Ἀσιανῶν ἀκροαμάτων θ. Plu. Ant. 24.

children.label: III
children.definition: feast, banquet, Id. Aet.Gr. 2.301f, Cleom. 34.
festive, ἀμφίπολοι Βρομίου Nonn. D. 45.270.
meeting-place of a θίασος, Hsch.
member of a θίασος, Ar. Ra. 327 (lyr.), Is. 9.30, IG 2(2).1237.95; θ. καὶ ἐρανισταί Arist. EN 1160a19.

θιασῶται τοῦ θεοῦ τούτου (sc. Ἔρωτος) worshippers of Love, X. Smp. 8.1; Ἀφροδίτης οἱ θ. IG 2(2).1261.23; ὁ ἐμὸς θ. my fellow-reveller, E. Ba. 548 (lyr.); οἱ ἑαυτοῦ θ. fellow-members of his θ., IG 2(2).1237.73.
leader of θίασοι, AP 9.524.9.
follower, disciple, Luc. Fug. 4; Πλάτωνος Them. Or. 2.33c.
belonging to a θίασος, Arist. Oec. 1346b15, BCH 50.233 ( Thasos).

definition: θιασῶτις, ιδος, ἡ, fem. of θιασώτης, Opp. C. 4.298.

children.definition: basket plaited from papyrus, PPetr. 3p.145 (iii B.C.), PCair.Zen. 69 (iii B.C.), PGrenf. 1.14.10 (ii B.C.), LXX Ex. 2.3, 6, Suid.: the form θίβη given by Hsch., Phot., v.l. in Suid., is false: θῆβις (sic) τῶν ἄρτων, correction of πρόθεσις τ. ἄ., UPZ 149.21 (iii B.C.):— Hsch. also gives θίβωνος (extra ordinem) · κιβωτός ( Cypr.), and θίγωνος· κιβωτοῦ. (Hebr. tēbhāh, from Egypt. dbet ‘box’.)

definition: θιβρός or θιμβρός ( v.l. in Nic. Th. 35), ά, όν,

children.definition: hot, ὠεὰ θ. χελύνης ( ἑψηθέντα ἐπʼ ἀνθράκων Sch., cf. Hsch.), Nic. Al. 555, cf. Th. 35.

children.label: II
children.definition: delicate, dainty, luxurious, Κύπρις Call. Fr. 267; θ. Σεμίραμις Euph. 81.—Only in Alex. poets. [ ῐ in the Spartan pr. n. Θίβρων, Philosteph.Com. 1.]
cover, lid, dub. in Schwyzer 323 C 39 (Delph.).

definition: θιγγάνω, fut. προσ-θίξῃ prob. for -εις E. Heracl. 652: 2 fut. τεθίξομαι Id. Hipp. 1086: aor.2 ἔθῐγον Archil. 71, E. Ba. 304, etc.; Lacon. inf. σιγῆν Ar. Lys. 1004:— Pass., aor. θιχθῆναι S.E. M. 9.258:—

children.definition: touch, handle: abs., μὴ θίγγανε IG 12(3).451 ( Thera), etc.: usu. c. gen., οἴακος A. Ag. 663, etc.; χερσὶ or χερὶ θ. τινός, Id. Th. 44, E. Ba. 1318; διʼ ὁσίων χειρῶν S. OC 470: c. acc., χεῖρα (s. v.l.) Νεοβούλης θιγεῖν Archil. l.c.; χερσὶ γλαυκᾶς ἐλαίας θιγοῦ[σʼ ὄζον] Limen. 6 (dub. l.):— Pass., to be touched, Arist. HA 495a6.

take hold of, τινος S. Aj. 1410 (anap.), etc.; θ. ὠλέναισιν τέκνου embrace, E. Ph. 300 (lyr.); θ. γυναικός have intercourse with . . , Id. Hipp. 1044; θ. εὐνῆς ib. 885, cf. S. OC 329: abs., E. El. 51; γλίχεται θιγεῖν καὶ συνεῖναι, of manʼs aspiration after God, Phld. D. 3.1.
